reviews.review_title: Ripped off Wreck it Ralph and its audience
reviews.content:
The Emoji Movie 3 out of 10.
On all levels, it is a derivative of Wreck it Ralph and similar movies, replicating its premise, characters and themes, but executed without any nuance, design, substance or purpose. Where Wreck it Ralph is built on easy nostalgia-bait, the Emoji Movie seems to be a series of advertisements and product placements for Just Dance, Candy Crush and other apps. The Emoji Movie goes so far as to copy the twist regarding the female lead.The viewing experience is tiring as the comedy the movie strings its plot points together with is either knowingly lazy, or arrogantly naive. Humour in this movie is supposedly evident when high five throws up candy, monkeys say they are off to do "monkey business", or when Sir Patrick Stewart, the poop emoji says the words "stink", "duty", and -
Emoji 1: "Poop, youre so soft"
Sir Patrick Stewart as the poop emoji: "Not too soft I hope"The animation was basic, but not poor and distracting, so I guess that makes it boring. The world of 'Textopolis' and the phone was very basic and bare, even with all the bright colours on the screen. The music in this movie is played very obnoxiously, with half relevant dance songs such as, wake me up before you go-go, feel this moment and cheerleader to name a few. The icing on the cake to this movie is when it ends on an impromptu dance party, where everyone comes to accept the main character instantly, kinda like, but worse than, Despicable Me, Megamind and The LEGO Movie.
The relationships between the main three characters, the high five, the meh and jailbreak was more like 3 people hanging around each other, going to the same place, than high five and meh being friends and jailbreak any sort of love interest.
The slang made to relate to kids was also outdated by the time this movie came out. Having James Corden say shade, #blessed, lit and slay was really forced and unnecessary. I would also rather leave out the references in this movie that do not appeal to kids and are not enough to appeal to adults. The poop emoji pretending to be in star trek, the culture of internet trolls and the Trojan horse virus.
Kids deserve better than a cheap 86 minute distraction - see The Lego Movie or Wreck it Ralph instead, which both executed an 'it's okay to be yourself/different' story on a far greater level.

I was fortunate enough (and by that I mean unfortunate enough) to see The Emoji Movie before it's official release date. It was awful. I do not recommend this movie AT ALL. Its morals are forced, most of the jokes are terrible, and it's completely cliché. I didn't expect it to be good, and I was right. Don't see this movie.

In the modern world, using emojis in text, from facial expressions to common objects, symbols, places and types of weather, and animals, has become the norm, and someone had the bright (stupid) idea to make a movie set in a world full of them! Basically, in a digital city called Textopolis, inside the mobile phone of a user, school teenager Alex (Jake T. Austin), lives thousands of emojis. Gene (Office Christmas Party's T. J. Miller) is the "meh" emoji, son of meh emojis Mel (Steven Wright) and Mary (Jennifer Coolidge), who can make multiple expressions despite his parents' upbringing. His parents are hesitant about him going to work, but Gene insists as he wants to feel useful. Alex receives a text from his love interest Addie McCallister (Tati Gabrielle), and he decides to send her an emoji. When Gene is selected, he panics, sending out a panicked expression, and causes the wreckage of text centre. Gene is called in by Smiler (Maya Rudolph), a smiley emoji and leader of the text centre, who concludes that Gene is a "malfunction" and therefore must be deleted. Gene is chased by bots but is rescued by Hi-5 (James Corden), a once-popular emoji who has since lost his fame due to lack of use. Hi-5 tells Gene that he can be fixed if they find a hacker, and he hopes to reclaim his fame while helping him. Smiler sends more bots to search for Gene when she finds out that he has left Textopolis, and his actions have made Alex think his phone is starting to go wrong and needs fixing. Gene and Hi-5 come to a piracy app where they meet a hacker emoji named Jailbreak (Anna Faris), who wants to reach Dropbox so that she can live in the cloud. Smiler's bots find the trio and attack them, but they escape into the game Candy Crush. Jailbreak reveals that Gene can be fixed in the cloud, and the group travel through the Just Dance app. While there, Jailbreak is revealed to be a princess emoji who fled home after tiring of being stereotyped. They are again attacked by bots, and their actions cause Alex to delete the Just Dance app. Gene and Jailbreak escape, but Hi-5 is taken with the app into trash. Mel and Mary go searching for Gene, arguing on the way, but making up in the Instagram app, where Mel reveals is a malfunction, explaining Gene's behaviour. While travelling through Spotify, Jailbreak admits that she likes Gene just the way he is and that he should not be ashamed of his malfunction. Gene and Jailbreak start to fall in love, and he quietly debates his choice to change himself. They reach the trash and rescue Hi-5 but are soon attacked by a bot upgraded with illegal malware. They evade it after entering Dropbox, where they encounter a firewall. After many tries, the group enter a password, which is Addie's name, to enter the cloud, where Jailbreak prepares to reprogram Gene. Gene admits his feelings for Jailbreak, but she turns him down, breaking Gene's heart and unintentionally causing him to revert to his apathetic programming. Suddenly, the upgraded bot sneaks into the cloud and captures Gene, prompting Hi-5 and Jailbreak to go after him, using a Twitter bird which Jailbreaks summons in her princess form. As Smiler prepares to delete Gene, Mel and Mary arrive. Mel reveals to everyone that he is also a malfunction, prompting Smiler to threaten to delete him as well. Jailbreak and Hi-5 arrive and disable the bot, which falls on top of Smiler. Alex takes his phone to a technical support store intending to return it to a factory reset and restore his phone's functionality, which will cause the destruction of Textopolis. In desperation, Gene prepares to have himself texted to Addie, making numerous faces to express himself. Addie receives this text message, whilst the phone is being reset, and Alex realises this. Alex cancels the factory reset just before everything is wiped, saving the emoji world, and Alex is confident to speak to Addie, who likes the emoji she was sent. Gene accepts himself for the emoji he is and is celebrated by all other emojis, while Smiler has joined the "loser lounge", full of many other unused and forgotten emojis. Also starring Sir Patrick Stewart as Poop, Christina Aguilera as Akiko Glitter, America's Got Talent's Sofía Vergara as Flamenca, Rachael Ray as Spam, and Will & Grace's Sean Hayes as 'Devil' Steven, with additional voices by Elizabeth Daily, Phil LaMarr, and Tara Strong. The cast of well-known stars voicing the familiar emojis are okay, the animation is colourful, I personally didn't mind the commercialism and blatant company plugs (Facebook, YouTube, Instagram, Candy Crush, Twitter, Spotify and many more), but I agree the plot is thin, it often gets annoying, it is not very funny, and I doubt even kids will be entertained, no wonder it was swamped by negativity, it is pretty 💩, a silly animated science-fiction comedy. It won the Razzies for Worst Director for Tony Leondis, Worst Screen Combo for Any Two Obnoxious Emojis, Worst Screenplay, and Worst Picture. Adequate!
It's really really really bad, it tries too hard to be funny and fails miserably! It is most definitely one of the worst animated movies ever made!Incredibly frustrating experience.Must-not-watch!

Okay, where do I begin with this film. Well it is a movie. One that was masterfully animated might I add. So let us dive into the film itself as a whole and the amount of plot points it has and doesn't need. For 1, it is first and foremost a movie about love an acceptance. Good for kids, until you have one of the villains straight up murder some guy. Yeah, there's a lot of murder in this movie, 16 deaths in total, all murder. This may have been the first time I yelled "Oh sh*t" in a kids movie, that's how out of place the murder was. Let's not forget that this movie isn't just about emoji love but human love too. Love between two freshmen high school who's entire life is their phone, as masterfully narrated by T.J. miller. In comes gene, the son of the emoji's whose only job is to do the "meh" face. They live in "Textopolis" a city just made out of emoji's. Don't fret about this place, it doesn't matter after about 30 minutes in. Gene messes up and puts the entire phone in danger for being deleted (Which in this case means death. The inhabitants of this phone would be murdered and understand this so they're pretty terrified) forcing gene to run away from angry murder bots out to ki- I mean delete him. So he goes to find a hacker (Hackers live in phones somehow) in the piracy app (I wanna apologize but there are so many issues I just have to mention in parenthesis like what is a piracy app?) where everyone who lives in that app is, you guessed it, f*cking pirates. Here they meet a hacker whose name is jailbreak cause "ha ha ha, I'm sure kids will get that reference," but hey at least they're treating their audience like adults even though it's directed at 1 to 10 year olds, I digress. Jail break says they can upload them to the cloud where they can be free, reprogram gene to not be expressive, and turn the high five emoji (his name is just high five) into a popular emoji again so he can end back up in the popular lounge where only the most used emojis go (this is his entire character arch). So they leave the piracy app and go to some other app, I don't remember although I do know they passed through the Facebook app which is why I have to write this stupid review. The movie is pretty much a giant ad for other apps. Like Facebook, twitter, Instagram, spottily, just dance app, etc. So here is where it gets contrived, there are way too many plot points. Let me run down a quick list before we get back to our snarky summary cause f*ck this movie1. Being an outcast 2. Love 3. Emoji love 4. Not knowing how to talk to girls 5. The murder (deletion) of everyone and thing on this kids phone 6. Emoji marriage issues 7. Being a mess up (I'm looking at you gene) 8. Accepting yourself 9. feminism (this ones an issue cause there is one line about it before it's just never mentioned again, ever) 10. Asking a girl to a dance 11. AddictionAnd not to mention any of the other throw away plots just doused in the film. Honestly this film is all over the place and has no real direction cause for every created plot point one is thrown away. Let's get back to the movie, one of the apps they visit is "Candy Crush" cause that's a popular app that paid for time here. So gene almost gets murdered during a giant game of candy crush and you find out that high five emoji is a caffeine addict. Next app they go too is the just dance app where they're told they want to be very quiet cause murder bots are after them (Anti Virus bots) so of course they accidentally get caught in a really loud game of just dance where if you don't dance good you get killed. So jailbreak sucks at dancing and just when you thought the movie couldn't get worse there is a horrible dance number. Murder bots find them and download a dance mode so they can dance and catch up to our three hero's but the phone is playing just dance in real life too and so the kid deletes the app in a frenzy cause the entire world of that app to fall apart. High Five dies along with all the murder bots. Everyone is heartbroken for a few minutes and then onward on our quest to Dropbox. So we go through one last app, "Spotify" where all music is streamed. Because every movie needs horrible puns all the music is a stream that you can boat down. They boat down some song made in 2014 or something and then end up in a nice slow stream where gene and jailbreak are doing some major crushing. Then out of f*cking nowhere and I mean nowhere this kids downloaded whale song (which wouldn't even be on spotify cause it was a download) defies the rule this movie has where all music is a stream and becomes a go*damn whale. So they leave, go to the trash bin where they find out high five emoji is alive save him (but not the just dance girl who is obviously traumatized and was crying) leaving the rest of the trashed apps to die. Now I'm almost at my limit, there is a lot wrong with this movie but if your drunk or with a few buddies I'm sure you could have fun with it. There's too many extra plots to finish this review in under 1000's words so I'll leave with this. the movie sucks.

I'm only here to stretch the fact that although the movie has a bunch of production flaws including, wrong timed lines where pauses were needed, predictable story, empty characters and all and all a movie that's constantly on the verge of being boring, it has its pros too.I felt the animation, soundtrack and voices were really good and there was certainly a great deal of talent behind them. The movie on its own will likely be amusing to most young children (which i hope was the target audience) but other than that, i don't believe an older teen or adult would find this as enjoyable as the other animations available. The movie has been slandered and insulted in many ways and at this point I'm referring back to my Summary Title:Bad, but not the worst.

...but fails to deliver.Ever since I've seen the trailer for this movie, I've been looking forward to seeing it. The trailer promised so much, but in the end, it was one of those movies that had all the best bits shown in the trailer.The concept for the movie is original and I was expecting the narrative to be another Despicable Me, The Lego Movie, or Wreck It Ralph, level quality. Let the truth be told, sony just laid a dump on all of us, poor sound, animation was good but it's lacking a bit.
if it would be released before some animated movies it would be good but this was a real disappointment

Review:
My expectations for this movie really wasn't that high, especially after reading all of the bad reviews but after watching it, I was surprised to see that it actually had a back story. Although it's made for kids, we all can relate to the various apps which are mentioned throughout the film, and the different emoji's which help us to make texting easier but from an entertainment point of view, it really didn't do it for me. The jokes are pretty weak, for kids and adults, along with the storyline which become tedious after a while. Anyway, the movie is based within a phone, were the Emojis live in the city of Textopolis, hoping to be used by the user. Like every phone, each emoji has there own face expression, except for Gene (T.J. Miller) who can change his expressions, which is against there policy. When Gene is finally up to become an emoji on the users phone, he's unable to stick to one expression, which crashes the emoji database. The leader of the emojis, Smiler (Maya Rudolph) is forced to punish Gene for crashing the database, by deleting him all together, so he escapes from Textopolis, with the help of Hi-5 (James Corden) and Jailbreak (Anna Faris), and they try to break back into the phone with Smilers soldiers close behind them. Jailbreak uses her skills to get Gene back into the phone but they have to go through various apps to get through the backdoor in the users phone. While they are doing this, the users phone isn't working properly, so he goes to the App Store to delete all the apps, which will destroy Textopolis. With there life's in danger, and time against them, Gene and his pals have to convince the user that they should stay on the phone, even though Gene caused all of the problems in the first place. It's quite a sweet story, and the relationship between Gene and Jailbreak was quite emotional but it was all a bit childish for me. The animation was half decent but nothing amazing, and the various characters wasn't too bad, especially Hi-5 but there wasn't memorable moments. Personally I think that the director made a bad movie out of a good idea, which is why it didn't go down to well with audiences, even though it made a hefty profit. Disappointing!Round-Up:
This movie was directed and written by Tony Leondis, 50, who also brought you Lilo & Stitch 2 and Igor. With all of the different emojis, the director could have gone in many directions with this film but he chose to stick to one character, which was a bad choice in my eyes. His previous projects also wasn't that great, so I think that Sony made a big mistake picking him for the project. As I wasn't expecting much from this film, I wasn't that surprised with the outcome so it just has to go down as a bad attempt at a good concept.Budget: $50million
Worldwide Gross: $217millionGenre: Animation, Adventure, Comedy
Cast: T.J. Miller, James Corden, Anna Faris, Maya Rudolph, Steven Wright, Jennifer Coolidge, Patrick Stewart, Christina Aguilera, Sofia Vergera, Rachael Ray, Sean Hayes and Jake T. Austin. 3/10

reviews.review_title: This movie is generic and unimaginative in every light. Do not even watch this ironically.
reviews.content: I am genuinely astonished that we live in an age where you could live to see the release of Star Wars, A Clockwork Orange, Full Metal Jacket,Pink Floyd: The Wall, and Liar Liar and still be in your healthy 40's to see a movie based off of glorified electronic hieroglyphs. The characters are so one dimensional that I only needed to see the extended movie trailer to know the motivations and personalities of each character. There is the main character, going about his life until one day, he messes up his job and needs to climb back up to his position where he could save the day. On the way, he has a love interest with a troubled past, the idiotic sidekick that means well and tries to help the main character but just gets in the way. There is the Den of Deplorables where the scum and the forgotten reside. Then, there is the constant "threat" overhanging the world that has the possibility of destroying their community if the character does not hurry up. Then there is an impenetrable obstacle in the way that blocks the character's path of least resistance. Finally, there is the scene where the love interest and main character go through a beautiful scene where they both learn that there is a meaning to life (for example, look at Wall-e.) Finally, the main character gets the girl, solves the problem, and everyone is saved. It is the most carbon copy coming-of-age story imaginable. Don't see this movie. Not even ironically. Do not give these people any money.

reviews.review_title: just a light thing to watch in train
reviews.content:
Actually, the movie overall tells a nothing teaching story. It is basically about an emoji running away from other emojis. It doesn't really have a plot twist, moral or either characters that I could identify to. 
 But if you want a movie to just watch on wait to work I think that this movie is good for this. That's because even if you don't focus on it for a few seconds (or even minutes) you won't miss many things.

reviews.review_title: Hollywood on a path to hell?
reviews.content: This is a very disturbing development. It is time to question the mental faculties of today's producers, directors and even actors that are willing to participate in this 'what-ya-ma-call-it'. Horrible, writers coming up with these screenplays. These ideas. These insults to the human intelligence. All I can say is steer clear of this monstrosity and protect your kids from ever having to see this. It will cause a huge traumatic experience and will leave them scarred for life. And, to make things even worse, it could cause mutations. Kids could be born with a phone attached to their arm instead of a hand.
Everyone thinks this movie is s**t but it's actually good! Just enjoy it. Remember... it's just an animation, just for fun and don't take it too seriously!
Like really. The movie is fine, but why are there so many 10/10?I get that you want the movie to get a higher score, but people that rate everything either 10 or 1 are so............

reviews.review_title: The most controversial movie for no reason
reviews.content:
There are a lot of 10 and 1 out there , most of them are 1 anyway .I read the critics ,the meta one and tried to grasp anything but i couldn't,and i am still confused why it's been rated so law.Not the best movie for sure,not the best dialogue or even story could have been better if they hired real geeks in writing process.But still it's worth watching for the slightly fun you will get , for to see how the going to connect the dots and where it will lead eventually.I don't think this is spolier (as it is mentioned in Trailer)but an emoji with multi character? It's good one .By the end of the movie i wished there were some cooperation in some kind to make the emojis on the phone animated , better yet to have that surprising emoji
In conclusion,. It's not the best if you are looking for one ,but still deserve a chance and worth to watch so thumbs up 👍🏻

reviews.review_title: Light and cheesy - not as awful as some might say, but not stellar.
reviews.content: I've noticed this movie is getting a lot of hate ratings, and I wonder how many of the people that have rated it 1 have actually seen the movie. I have seen some movies that are worth rating a 1 before, but The Emoji Movie isn't quite that bad. This was the perfect movie for my 11 year old son, as he LOVED It! I was mildly amused. The movie wasn't awful, and it wasn't great.The movie is about a "meh" emoticon that gets sent (by the user) while making a different face. Apparently, it is unheard of to make the wrong face, so that gets him into a lot of trouble. He befriends an emoticon that used to be popular, but is hardly ever used now, and they seek out a emoticon defector/hacker to help Gene (Meh), become the meh he thinks he is supposed to be. I felt the movie had a good message about being yourself, although the character's aren't given much depth in the film.If you are considering taking your kids to this because you want something to do, but are unsure because of your reviews, you could take a chance on it. If you are broke and don't go to the movies very often, however, wait for video or streaming. Overall, it is a light, cheesy watch if there isn't anything else to see with the kids.

Excruciatingly bad. It's proper rubbish.Based on the reputation of this, I knew it was going to be utter tripe. I always wait to watch myself to form my own opinion, but there is no doubt about it - 'The Emoji Movie' is truly awful. It's such a lazy attempt, there is absolutely no creativity and there doesn't seem to have been that much care put into this. How about that product placement, also?!I will say I do like the idea, you could probably create a fine film with it. However, man did they get the execution incredibly wrong. That's also not good given the cast performances, all of which are quite pathetic. In fairness, they don't exactly get much to work with.I'm someone who likes James Corden, but he is terrible here. As is T.J. Miller, while Anna Faris and Maya Rudolph are forgettable. I was disappointed (sorta) not to see more of Patrick Stewart's character, given how much I've heard in recent years; he's barely in it.It's a painful watch, even with a run time of just 86 minutes.

reviews.review_title: Bills Reviews For Short Attention Spans
reviews.content: I'm not going to be as rough on this as the rest of the users on IMdB are (3.5 rating). As a matter of fact, I'll use a character from the movie to describe it. Meh. That's right. There was nothing good or bad about this movie. It just kind unfolded in front of my glazed eyes over the screen. There were a few chuckles, but no laughs. And those who say it's offensive? No. A poop emoji is not offensive. This story stars the emoji misfits Meh, High Five & Hacker on their quest to have lives, and to save themselves from being deleted from the smart phone. They fight against Smiler, who runs the emoji's with an iron "smile", trollers, and malware bots. This movie would have made zero sense less than 20 years ago, and the movie is fading from my memory as I write this review about it. Not exciting, not boring. Save yourself from a "meh" evening.

reviews.review_title: Vile premise for a kid's movie
reviews.content: The less said about this vile, 90 minute ad, the better. This manipulative excuse for a movie deserves a 1 star in the hope that if it's universally panned, the studios won't be tempted to produce more of this vomit.I've noticed several 10 star reviews for this movie. Do not take any notice. These people are either trolls, or sad, obvious shills. They say alcohol consumption kills brain cells; it has nothing on this garbage.

It's not a terrible film as everyone says. It's not good either but it's not terrible. I actually borrowed the film from a friend of mine and a few weeks later they played it on Netflix...go figure. I really only watched it because I wanted to see if it really is the worst film of the year and honestly it's not. Like I said it's not a great film, it has it's cute moment but I wouldn't declare it the worst film of 2017 that goes to Mother! which you can read my review of that but let's not open that can of worms please. 
 The film is about this emoji who is a Meh who only job is to go meh when someone hits his emoji but he has all these other emojis that he can't keep straight so it effect his job and his boss wants to terminate him before he corrupt the entire work force. Basically the Meh emoji enlist his friends to help him from being deleted. Okay now that we have our pilot of the film let me tell you what I thought of the film a bit more. It was cute. I will admit I did like the message of the film to be yourself and not just stick to what you normally do. Branch out and be you. The Candy Crush part was pretty cute because I play that game so I enjoyed that scene but the dancing game to get to the next stage was a bit too predictable for my taste. 
 Should you watch this film? Well I guess if you have small kids they'll find it enjoyable and with today teenagers they'll understand the emojis because they have these smartphones with all the emojis from the film. I think they should pass a law that no kid under the age of 10 should own a cellphone! Kids are too wrapped up into their phones these days. My niece is 9 and she has a cellphone why? These kids ain't got nobody to call at that age except maybe their parents. It's silly if you ask me. So I suppose if you want to view it and see for yourself if you think it's the so called worst film of 2017 but I personality wouldn't view it again unless I have to. If I am forced to watch it again I'll remember to bring my book so at least I'll get some reading done.

I think the ratings on this movie are harsh! It is a kids film to be primarily enjoyed by kids not adults, and from what I gathered at the busy cinema - it was! My 6 year old certainly enjoyed it! And to be honest I didn't think it was that bad either (and I've sat through some unbearable kids movies!).

reviews.review_title: How you feel, says a lot about yourself and not the movie
reviews.content: We have to scoop back to neutrality here. The more reactive takes seem to have kind of missed the plot. You read the title before watching it yes or no ?....In what world was a satirical animation movie based of modern day's overused trash hieroglyphics going to make the top shelves or be a 7 or 8. It was never to be and that's not why anyone would have been inclined towards it in the first place.They pulled it off in my own vested opinion. It was funny - I laughed, satirical, and not too rough on the edges. It was never going to logically make sense in a million years, but that wasn't the point and that's not what got anyone in the studio.Instead the real criticism perhaps can be it's similarity to other animation pieces, however it's best to note where conceptually the assimilations could be placed before saying it's a cop-out. With the ratings alone I never thought I was going to watch it, but it's definitely not a 3/10, it's about a 5/10 and one extra for even pulling it off at all so a 6.If there was ever going to be world where this is a 7 or 8, the age rating would likely have to have been upscaled, and also the originality of this movie undoubted.

reviews.review_title: This Movie is As Useless As 💩
reviews.content: Do not watch this movie, watching this movie is a waste of time This movie is bad. Why would you make a movie about Emojis? Emojis are popular. In fact, I love them. 😄😁😃 But you shouldn't make a movie about them. What is Sony Animation going to make next? The Fidget Spinner Movie? The Dab Movie? The 3:00 AM Movie? This movie is bad. I can't even think of a better version of the Emoji Movie. Rule 1 of Writing a Plot for a movie: Never make a movie about something that you shouldn't make a movie about. 🙅🏻‍♂️🙅🏻‍♂️🙅🏻‍♂️🙎🏻‍♂️🙎🏻‍♂️🙎🏻‍♂️ How is this movie getting so much money?

reviews.review_title: A unique refreshing take on emojis
reviews.content: This film comes with an interesting take on the human-smartphone interaction. It profoundly personifies all the emojis. There isn't a dull moment in this one till the end. Excellent concept, great movie!

THE EMOJI MOVIE IS THE GREATEST MOVIE OF ALL TIME!!! THERE IS NO MOVIE BETTER THAN THIS!!!! IT DESERVES THE OSCAR FOR BEST PICTURE!!! IT IS THE GREATEST MOVIE OF ALL TIME!!!!!I mean, come on! Stale jokes, Patrick Stewart as a turd, 100% product placement, a plot that goes absolutely nowhere, lack of common sense anywhere throughout the movie? Oh sure, the FORMULA for a Best Picture winner! I SERIOUSLY wonder just what exactly was going through the minds of the people who worked on this! Let's be honest: among movies considered the worst, there's The Room, which quite frankly puts a smile on my face, and then there's this load'o'crap, a systematic brain-drain! Like, I could actually take The Room seriously compared to whatever this was! Hell, The Emoji Movie shouldn't even have been thought of in the first place!

reviews.review_title: Pretty much all what´s really bad about this movie are its critics
reviews.content:
As a european family we are frequently watching animated movies (in english) and know a big variety of those ranging from rather bad to amazing. We are a family of all ages from 6 to 50 and did not watch this movie for quite a while BECAUSE of its bad ratings (3.0). (so it should be one of the worst movies of all times).
After watching it, all of us completely disagree. It quite is funny, has some nice twists and an ok story. It one of the many 5.5 to 6.0 animations that are entertaining and easy to watch. 
I cannot understand either the rating nor some of the bad critics here.
Why is it a problem to have some similarities to other stories? (and hey yess Inside out has a trash dump too, and in Wreck it Ralph they also changing between apps)The book of life plays partially in the "world of the remembered" and Coco does too, that does not mean Coco is any less of a great movie.Don´t get me wrong! Of course the Emoji Movie is NOT Coco. But to my opinion its a solid 5 or even a weak 6. ...and to all those who said "we´ve seen it all before" here some IMDB ratings with no further comments ... Justice League 6.9
Avengers 8.1
The Flash 8.0
Spider-Man 7.3
The Amazing Spider-Man 7.0
Spider-Man Homecoming 7.5..and yes rotten tomatoes also slaughtered the movie, but we found more and more to not look at their critics because what we consider to be good movies seems to be quite different to their judgement. (e.g. Pixars "Brave" or "the golden compass" that we all here considered to be great movies)

reviews.review_title: You can Anticipate Movies Like This to be Pointless
reviews.content: The Emoji Movie is 😒 (meh)... Get it? No? Well, that's basically the entire movie summed up in one line; that, stupid and utterly boring. Not only is it completely obvious to those who have actually seen it or for those who can accurately judge a movie based on its trailer, but it's reported that children were squirming in their seats while sitting in the cinema. This may just be the worst animated family comedy of all time.The worst thing about The Emoji Movie is just how insanely boring it is and how weak the entire concept is. The film focuses on an emoji who can portray multiple expressions, so he goes on the run with two other misfits and it's just a borefest of an adventure inside the smartphone. Whoever decided to do an animated family adventure-comedy about emojis actually had a good idea, but it needs to match with a good story.And it's not just one of those slapstick films that kids will love and adults will hate, it's exceptionally boring for all audiences. The characters are horribly-designed and fail to be engaging. The writing in every other area of the film is terrible and there's very few jokes that are even acceptable for children's humour. James Corden's voice performance is super-annoying and for goodness sake! It's such a boring film! Keep yourself and kids away.If you liked this review, check out the full review and other reviews at aussieboyreviews.

The Emoji Movie (2017) is arguably the worst movie of 2017. It tries to be comedic and funny, while also having emotional depth. The final product has neither. What it does have is a poor script and cheap animation. The characters have little to no depth, and the scenes are not well placed. In the very beginning, there is an emotional scene between Gene (T.J. Miller) and his parents (Steven Wright and Jennifer Coolidge), before we know anything about the characters or what is happening. Most of the jokes fall flat. Also, this movie is basically a giant ad. Scenes include Candy Crush, Just Dance, and even Dropbox. Even the emojis themselves could be considered creative product placement.First, there are so many plot holes that the movie does not even remotely make sense. The emojis have to be scanned every time Alex (Jake T. Austin), the boy who owns their phone, wants to send one. Wouldn't it be easier for them just to have a picture taken and used every time? Alex can already see their pictures on the keyboard, so clearly they have them. Also, Gene and his friends are afraid of being "wiped" from the phone. Emoji come preprogrammed on every phone, so this would not even affect them. It also brings up many unanswered questions, such as: Why doesn't Alex just wipe the phone himself? What happens if he wants to use Jailbreak's princess emoji? Does the same world exist on everyone else's phones? And, shouldn't all phones with this software be having the same problems? In the beginning, when Gene panics and makes multiple faces while being scanned, it makes a strange-looking combination emoji. Then at the end, doing the exact same thing makes a cool-looking, animated emoji. There are too many flaws in the logic of this movie.Although other animated movies, such as Wreck-it Ralph, Trolls, Toy Story, and The Lego Movie, have successfully made a movie out of a product, those movies at least had depth and a good storyline. The Emoji Movie, on the other hand, simply states "This character is happy, that one is sad, and this one doesn't like the other two." Instead of gradually revealing the character's traits, this movie explicitly states them. One of its major flaws is that none of the characters change or learn anything except for Gene. The movie tries to have a theme of self-acceptance, but comes across as having no moral whatsoever.Overall, The Emoji Movie is an uncreative approach at making a movie out of something we see nearly every day, emoji. Possibly the only good thing about it is that it is available on Netflix. I don't recommend watching it, unless you have absolutely nothing else. Actually, even if you have nothing else, you might not want to watch it. This cheaply made Sony Animation movie is not worth wasting your time on.

reviews.review_title: The moral of this movie is text more
reviews.content: This movie is the Meh emoji, and how he has a lot of other expressions besides: Meh.I watched this movie with zero expectations, this movie is a product placement piece of trash, the moral of this movie is text more! And it's terrible, it's just SO bad.

reviews.review_title: Doesn't deserve as much hate as it gets.... but it's still really bad
reviews.content: The emoji movie is a feature length commercial literally about emojis. The "film" has even more product placement than an Adam sander film. The only positive about this movie was that the animation is actually pretty nice, but other from that don't waste your money on a commercial. And don't say that just because the film is essentially a feature length commercial that it can't be good, because the LEGO movie was all about product placement, and that was an animated masterpiece.

reviews.review_title: 2 stars because at least it was HILARIOUSLY bad...
reviews.content: Terrible plot, unfunny and... James Corden.Need I say more?Well according to IMDB I do. A minimum of 150 characters in fact!So finally, let me recommend that you avoid it. Having said that, my children have watched it twice. I have no idea why.

what did I just watch? This is the worst animated movie I have ever seen in my life. This movie was worse than foodfight and Mars Needs Moms and this was worse than Minions. This was even worse than the trailers. This movie was worse than I thought it would be. The thing that really angers me is that they canceled the Popeye movie for this crap movie. Do not go see this in theaters! You will waste your money! I am saving you and your money! All of the jokes were not funny and the whole movie was so stupid.

I had very low expectations about this movie due to its extremely low rating, but it's actually not so bad. I've seen a lot of worse animated pictures and I'm clueless about why the rating is so low. I'm also unsure, however, why there are so many user reviews rating it 10. It's an average children's animated movie which adults can also vaguely enjoy.

reviews.review_title: How many cliches can there be?
reviews.content: "How bad could this movie be" was my feeling before watching this. And to be honest, pretty bad. Main idea of the movie seems to be hand jokes, name dropping different apps and references to basically any entertainment related things. Towards the end I was just trying to find all these references. It's like the movie tried to take the plot from wreck-it Ralph and Inside out, but fails miserably. Mix in some forced gender equality and you end up with a pretty bad movie. Best parts were cat video, poop emoji and few actually funny hand jokes. But too much is too much. I did watch the whole movie, so it wasn't all bad. Maybe if it wasn't just about the puns, the movie could've had it's moments. Now there really weren't.

I read the book of this film when I was but a mere boy. I despised the Novel by Charles Dickens as I was a retarded child but now I am a man and am able to look beneath the surface of this total masterpiece and will share my interpretation of it with you. Gene is a very relatable hero played by funny man, T.J Miller. His struggle is both believable and emotional and you really feel for his pain. His conflict with the villainous Smiler represents racism and class struggle in the United States of America under Trump's reign of terror. Hi-5 is Gene's unexpected friend for life throughout the movie played by funny man, James Corden known for his work on Carpool Karaoke. The show that won't get out of YouTube trending. He acts as the catalyst for many knee-slapping jokes. He was once Alex's favourite emoji but as time progressed he is but a useless emoji who spends all his time in the "loser lounge". This is symbolism for Lucifer's fall from heaven as he is cast down by his god to the deepest, darkest depths of hell. This is seen again when Hi-5 is left in the trash after the destruction of Just Dance. Jailbreak is a strong independent female who don't need no man. I totally ship GeneBrake. However I was disappointed they do not smash. Not even once! But this just a nitpick and I'm sure we will see this if the geniuses behind this masterpiece (Sony pictures animation) decide to create a sequel to this work of perfection. Poop is played by Sir Patrick Stuart and the joke here is that Poop is played by Sir Patrick Stuart. It gets me every time. Alex, the phone user, acts as God. He is and omnipotent being who hears and sees all. He owns the phone and is worshipped by all emojis who inhabits it. However he is displeased by the emojis and seeks to destroy them. This is symbolism for when God sent the great flood to cleanse the world by destroying its inhabitants. The here is that Alex changes his decision whereas God wipes the entirety of the humans aside from an old man and his family who built a boat. In conclusion The Emoji Movie is a flawless work of art which cannot be criticised and if you do you worship Satan and practice the works of the devil.Thank you for listening to my TED talk. Goodbybe

reviews.review_title: Here is why people are rating it low and an Honest option
reviews.content: This movie does not deserve the rank it has. The only real reason it's so low is because a few Youtuber's thought it would be funny to tell their fans to go rate this movie low as they could. Here is what I think, first off its a kids movie so yes the plot wasn't made to be complex its made for kids. The only reason I took a star or two off is because it's not the first movie to do this. This is a mesh of Wreck it Ralph and Inside Out. (both have decent ratings) if you have kids its worth at least watching.

I hate this film to the bone! This film sucks on so many levels that I'm impressed on how bad the emoji movie is. It wasn't even watchable! I didn't see it in theaters because I thought it was going to be garbage. So I saw it on Netflix and boy o' boy I regret it. The emoji movie was boring, unfunny, it had horrible characters and a horrible plot. I'm not even joking this is one of the worst movies I've ever seen. I'd rather watch Batman and robin again or transformers again! This movie is a product placement dumpster fire! Don't ever see it don't even see it on Netflix.

Don't even bother with the good reviews, they are just jokes that people made, but, read the good reviews as if it was opposite day, because this movie is AWFUL, TERRIBLE, UPMOST DISGUSTING, HORRIBLEEEE, i hate this movie, so much, but i am not angry at the movie, rn im craving bleach because this movie is so shit, btw if you want a GOOD sound stupid is actually awesome movie, go watch the lego movie, one of my favorites of the genre
-10/100

reviews.review_title: I hate myself for think this would be good.
reviews.content: The Emoji Movie and The Garbage Pail Kids are tied for the worst movie I have ever seen.For those that don't know, The Garbage Pail Kids Movie is an 80s movie based on a card game. And boy, that movie was horrible! The Garbage Pail KIds themselves all look ugly and are poorly designed. You should see the Nostaglia Critic review on this and The Emoji Movie because The Garbage Pail Kids just absolutely broke Doug Walker (the host).Onto The Emoji Movie. First off, who came up with this? It's cringy and full of stupidity. Second, the charecters are all brats. Jailbreak is always acting so bossy even when she's not the one in trouble. High-5 was the worst one of all...He has a very annoying voice, terrible humor, and just useless in the journey except for just causing more chaos. Gene was boring, hardly did anything. However, I must give some credit to the animatio in this movie, it's amazing! But still save your time and money.Score: 1.5/10
I can't describe the hate I have for this. Does it count as a movie, or a 90-minute unskippable ad?

This review will be short because I can sum it up in just a few words.This is the first time (out of thousands of movies) That I have ever gave a 1 out of 10.Longer version : There simply wasn't a single redeemable part of this movie. The animation was terrible (seriously it looks like something from 2004 not 2017), the story line um....there really isn't one except "Three unlikely friends have to save the world, but really don't do much to reach the goal until the final Macguffin. For an all star cast, it sounded like the actors all had guns to their head. Stale deliveries abound like the 800 product placements that litter this movie. In other words, I can almost always find something good in a movie. I never give out 1's. I VERY Rarely give a 10. To me, an 8 means it's a great movie. A 10 means it's just a work of art and transcends being just a movie. I think the worst score I've ever given before was a 3 because even in bad movies, there are redeeming qualities such as maybe great cinematography or a particular scene or actor that stuck out, or even just good editing.This movie has no redeeming qualities whatsoever. I took my niece and nephew to it (7 and 9 years old) and even they were asking "Can we just leave and go watch a different movie?" about 20 minutes in. And that's exactly what we did.Seriously, I hate that most people vote either 1 or 10 most of the time because why have a scale at all if you are one of those people. In this case, this movie deserves all of the 1's it gets.The only reason it is even rated 1.6 is because of the blatantly obvious corporate review shrills. So after being on IMDb for like 13 years now, I finally found a movie that was so bad that it earned my first 1 star rating. I'd give it a 0 if I could.
I am so glad that this won Razzie awards because, we've seen this idea before, this film is undoubtedly garbage. And I am glad people hated it.

reviews.review_title: It's disappointing how underrated this movie is.
reviews.content: I feel like this movie had a good message for kids and well, everyone. I don't understand why it was so hated. My family and I were really hoping for a sequel. I think people need to give this another chance.
Annoying,boring and so may advertisments,just a waste of time,its so bad,dont watch it

I seriously do not understand all of these reviews that are giving this movie such a low rating. I'm not a kid, nor do I have children of my own. I'm 36yrs old and usually don't watch animated films, but I love this movie!! This movie is truly great for all ages. As far as emojis go, they nailed it with how technology is today. reviews.review_title: A lazy, unfunny, and uncreative film.
reviews.content: They say that Hollywood can make a movie based on everything. With the help from some good writers and a talented director, they can bring a product we wouldn't dream of being in a movie to life and leave an influence on future movies. Where a movie like "The Lego Movie" does it right, a movie like "The Emoji Movie" does not. In fact, the latter doesn't do it right at all. It fails on every single level imaginable resulting in one of the worst animated movies I've ever seen in my entire life with a clichéd story, uncreative animation, and characters so annoying and unlikeable that at times you might actually get drawn to your own smartphone. If you want further proof that this movie is awful, here's the clichéd premise I was talking about.On the smartphone of a high school student named Alex (Jake T. Austin), an entire urban city filled with "the most important form of communication ever invented" (that is exactly what the film said, I am not kidding), emojis. Each one has a specific personality and has to act the certain way. However, a meh emoji named Gene (T.J. Miller) exhibits multiple personalities and is considered an outcast by the other emojis. Gee, where have I seen that before? After causing chaos, he is hunted down by evil bots headed by Smiler (Maya Rudolph in yet another awful animated movie) and runs into a hand emoji named Hi-5 who along with a hacker emoji named Jailbreak (Anna Faris) attempt to leave the phone and try to get to the Cloud. Along the way, they go through multiple apps just there to get some product placement in while trying to avoid the evil Smiler. There's also some subplots involving Gene's parents (Steven Wright and Jennifer Coolidge) getting separated along with Alex having trouble expressing his feelings to a girl he likes, but considering that I already lost some sanity watching this awful movie, I'd rather movie on.After I saw the abomination that was last years "Norm of the North", I thought that there would be no animated movie that could possibly be worse, that is until I saw this. It's not only really bad, it's unbearable. The thing I hate most about this awful movie is how much money the film wasted. It apparently cost fifty million dollars to make this movie and just thinking about it makes me enraged. Imagine what you could have done with that money rather than make this garbage. You could have built a homeless shelter in every single state in America or you could have given it to the poor so they won't go to bed hungry. But no, Sony Pictures Animation just had to waste it on a movie so awful that it might have given me brain damage. The story is nothing but clichés. Every single plot point had already been done and the film decided to steal the creativity from great animated movies like "Wreck-It Ralph", "The Lego Movie" and "Inside Out". Not only that, but most of the film is just devoted to product placement which I'll just say is some of the worst in film history. I'm not joking when I say that it plays apps like Instagram, Candy Crush Saga, Twitter, Facebook, Just Dance, YouTube, Spotify and especially Dropbox  have integral plot points to this film. Even the ending to this movie, which I won't spoil, makes absolutely no sense whatsoever. The animation is also highly uncreative. While it's not bad, it looks absolutely unimaginative and has no creativity put into it. Every single world in this movie has been shown better in other films. I honestly can't blame the animators for this as these poor people are being treated like paper by their terrible and stupid managers as was revealed in a leaked letter from 2014. As for the characters, well, what do you think? There's bland, clichéd, extremely unfunny and have phoned in voice performances from its actors. I honestly have no idea why any of these actors accepted this movie. My only guess is that they were blackmailed in to doing it by Sony. Then again, I don't blame them for not putting any effort into this."The Emoji Movie" is one of, if not the worst animated movie released so far this decade. I hated every single thing about this movie. It's an absolute insult to the animation genre as a whole and has no reason to exist on this planet at all. I really hope the Razzies consider this movie for Worst Picture because if there's anything this film will be remembered for, is as the movie that was made just to cash in on a fad. Let's hope that Hollywood will learn it's lesson with this film,  just because you can make a movie based on anything, doesn't mean you should.

Well, the one film critics were anticipating is finally here. I went to see it myself and found that nobody was kidding about how bad this movie was!The story is Gene a meh emoji can't keep a straight face for some poorly explained reason and is outcast for that, along with High 5 and Jailbreak, the love interest. On the other side of the phone, Alex (the human) tries asking a girl out on a date, but his phone keeps humiliating him before he can pop the question.Nobody was kidding about how much this movie shamelessly rips off Wreck-it Ralph, Inside Out, and Lego Movie. The only difference between Inside Out and this movie is that Inside Out had plausible situations: if Sadness affected Riley, she would display it as a reaction to change happening around her. In this movie, if an emoji messes up, the phone literally jumps around and opens up unwanted apps. If it explained butt dialing, that would be one thing. Also, Wreck it Ralph had mostly familiar characters with an already attached story within the games they belonged to. Emojis have no story. It's the same as making a story for the Garbage Pail Kids cards. It also manages to rip off Chicken Little (unlikable characters), Through the Looking Glass (cop out ending), Bee Movie (hero searching for more in life through adventure), Foodfight (horrible puns and rips off Wreck it Ralph), and Toy Story. Even the director admits that he loved Toy Story so much that he wanted to make a toy movie that hadn't been touched yet.Another major problem is on Alex's side of the story, he tries to use an emoji to ask a girl out to the dance. First of all, nobody would be able to guess by an emoji that you want to go out on a dance. Second, she's literally two desks away from him that he could whisper to her or text her the words: "U wanna go out with me?" This makes the emojis unnecessarily important.All of the emoji characters are irritating in a unique way: Gene is the generic bland hero, Jailbreak is a "cool" love interest who turns out to be a princess (just like Wreck it Ralph!), High 5 is the useless "comic relief", Mel Meh is the unsupportive father that has a 180 character arc in the last twenty minutes, Smiler is the Joker wannabe, and everyone else is a bland jerk to Gene for no reason other than "he's different, shun him". Good storytelling doesn't depend on two dimensional characters to make the hero likable.I tried finding good things about the movie and found only two:1) The background and human animation: Sony is capable of doing some really good animation and it really shows with the phone world. Each app location does have a unique feel to it; not as impressive as Wreck it Ralph, but still really good. Also the human characters are a better improvement than Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs.2) The background jokes: The jokes that the movie loves to market are shockingly unfunny, but the barely noticed jokes are surprisingly funny. For instance Spam was funny and another joke involves an emoji Christmas tree who keeps shouting "Merry Christmas" and another emoji replies, "It's still September, Tim." That actually made me laugh! Why couldn't we have more of those jokes and less of "We're Number 2" jokes?I may have been merciful on those two elements, but the rest of the movie is awful with shameful rip offs, unfunny jokes, irritating clichés, wasted talent, and aggravating cash grab idea of exploiting emojis. If this movie came out before Wreck it Ralph and Inside out, I think it could have had a better chance of being less hated. I always thought that emoji toys were overrated and this movie nails why I think so. I'm tempted to not give Sony's Peter Rabbit and Star a chance, but I'm not that cruel. However, this movie is awful and I highly don't recommend it. I don't care if it's just for kids; they deserve better than this.

I don't know exactly why it is underrated. Yeah... it is mostly crappy and lacks substance, but still, it reaches to put a smile on your face. There's low chances you may have no fun watching it. It's entertaining, intriguing and keeps you engaged throughout it. I thought the average "meh" ratings would be 4 or 5, but are below that. Anyway, don't let reviews fully influence you to watch, or not, a film. In the end. it's up to you, and you have the choice whether to see it or not.

reviews.review_title: Just look at it as a satire of Disney/Pixar
reviews.content: After the secret life of your toys, the secret life of insects, the secret world of monsters under your bed, and the patently ridiculous secret world inside your brain, is it so surprising that some brain-dead executives would attempt 'the secret world inside your phone'? More kids these days care about phones than toys or their own brain, so wouldn't that make it more *important*? All those people who praised 'Inside Out' to the skies are to blame for this monstrosity of a movie, and the Emoji Movie is the next logical step for hooey children's entertainment.
Whether you know about emoji or not, whether you're adult or child ... this is a great fun movie, the bad reviews are unjustified, watch it as you'll not be disappointed !!!

reviews.review_title: A sad attempt at making a "hip and cool" movie
reviews.content: Wow. Words cannot describe what I have just seen. It is sad to see that Hollywood as sank this low in creating a film.The worst part wasn't the cliché dialogue or the terrible comedy. It wasn't the predictable and recycled plot. The worst part about this movie is that at one point, a group of executives sat together in a board room and thought, "What's something hip and cool that kids like?" and they all collectively agreed that and EMOJI movie would be the best idea.At one point I was in the middle of watching this and I came to the sad realization that I was watching a movie about EMOJIS. Overall, this movie was a sad attempt at trying to keep up with the times, and I hope that this is a Hollywood's final attempt at trying to do something like this.

The Emoji Movie is a boring and unfunny kids movie. It's not creative or original. The characters are bad, the story is bad and the humor is awful. The only positive thing I can say about it is the animation. It's actually quite nice to look at.All in all it's bad. I know 2/10 is brutal, but I did actually think about giving it a 4/10 for a majority of this movie, however then there were two scenes that just baffled me in how bad they were. I would not recommend this to anyone, but I think it's watchable for very very young kids.2/10

It has become a meme of how bad this movie is. After watching it I feel that it was not so bad.
The movie is basically Wreck-it Ralph meets Inside-Out. Those movies are hardly masterpieces to begin with, and to me their biggest quality was their high-concept premise. Wreck-it Ralph is already an adaptation of Toy Story but with video games and Inside Out is too transparent with its emotional arcs.
Anyway, that leaves us with a movie that does not have an original premise, does not have a visually unique aesthetic and has a very linear story. Yet, I did not hate this film. Is it boring? Yes definitely, but mostly because a lot of what it does I have already seen before. However, for younger audiences that have not seen a lot of movie this might not be an issue.Other than that, the movie suffers from flaws that are independent from the movie itself. These are problems that affect larger movies, and that have nothing to do with the story or the way it is told. For instance, the fact that every character is voiced by a celebrity. The omnipresent use of product placement or references to real life brands. It distracted me constantly. These things are not necessarily bad, and if you don't know what Dropbox or Spotify is, then you're fine. But for me, it made it harder to invest myself in the movie's universe. You cannot get lost if everything you see is recognisable.A positive thing that I will give the movie credit for, is that it makes good use of the emojis themselves. There is enough variety to make it interesting, even if it is not particularly inspired. (in other words it is rather "meh" (I'm so sorry))
Visually, the animations are well done. Technically the film holds up. That is why I do not understand the sheer hate this movie gets. It might be lazy sure, but it is not necessarily incompetent.That being said there was one sequence that irked me a little, when James Corden declares "you don't need real friends but you only need fans that give you unrelenting support as long as you are on top". This sequence, which revolves around being an ad for Facebook, goes totally unchallenged by the characters or the narrative, and it is rather strange message for a movie aimed at kids that might not grasp all the nuances and caveats of social media.Overall, the movie is heavily flawed and uninspired. Yet, I don't feel that it is dramatically different from any other modern children oriented animated movies. When compared to Wreck-it Ralph or Inside-Out, the former is saved by its love for video games and the latter works on the human story level, not so much on the heavy-handed metaphor. The emojis are not an old tradition with a passionate subculture and the over-arching story of the teen getting his phone wiped is not especially riveting. But there is fancy colours.

This is just Wreck it Ralph in emoji form. It is basically Inside Out in a meme trash stack of Emojis. Put those in a blender, and you get this trash. It is extremely cliché, if you say something is going to happen, chances are, it will happen. That is how predictable this movie is. It's just a cash grab. It's not those so bad it good movies. Just... DON'T WATCH THIS.

I personally enjoyed watching it, it was a simple, clean ish other than the emoji, lol humoured movie. I also think a lot of people can relate to how the main character felt and the simple message of embracing who you truly are is something people need to hear.I don't know what the true intentions were of all the 'product placement' but it makes sense to the movie, it would actually be kinda strange if it wasn't there. The animation wasn't bad either, purity good for the style they went with.All in all it was a good movie I think, and don't be ashamed of being apart of something others hate even if it's good. There was a lot to convey in those characters, so well done:)!

And for the whole school days we sometimes talk about why the movie is garbage and how the characters too atrocious (referring to the 3rd Dimensional smileys with arms and legs.) I said that I was gonna watch it after it's launch. and never did. For 3 years. Till in 2020, I thought that I was going to watch said movie title on Netflix. My sister has her subscription of Netflix for the both of us so it would be very easy to get ahold with the movie. So I actually watched it. At first I thought it was going to be worse just like the Internet thought but... In my opinion AGAIN, I don't love it... I don't hate it either... It's just In... The middle. Ok done.
Maybe 5 stars at best. But we got a bunch of liars out here giving bs reviews so now I gotta give it 1 star.

reviews.review_title: I found out what hot dogs are made of!
reviews.content:
Hated it. Here is why:
-As broken and cringe as humanly possible. I felt myself shiver during some scenes. I was just cheated out of 2 precious hours of my life.
-It was filled with product placements so blatantly pointless and awful I was hard pressed to not bury myself in a deep, deep hole in the ground with a ticking time bomb. A character even goes as far to say "We have to make it to Dropbox!"
-It was boring. I expected at least a little bit of decent action. None.
-It is a rip off of a lot of animated miracles of the decade. Like Inside Out or The Lego Movie. Or Wreck it Ralph. It explores characters trying to express themselves (Inside Out), Crazy haired feminists (The Lego Movie's Wildstyle, except the "feminist" in The Emoji Movie was kind of a vehicle to propel what is right nowadays), and going to different apps (Wreck it Ralph, apps instead of video games).
-The "jokes" were so unoriginal and predictable and unfunny I had to have a cold water bottle next to me so I could douse myself to stop my brain from overheating.
-The ending of this abomination should have made me happy. You know, the movie is over, I can go back to living a regular life, but it didn't. It was so infuriatingly out of touch about how kids act nowadays that I was considering tearing out my brain and selling it for export so I wouldn't have to remember it. In fact, this whole movie was out of touch with what will make an audience happy. It only exists to capitalize on the popularity of emojis. I could shun this movie even more, but won't. Just, ignore it. Okay guys?
Thanks.

reviews.review_title: I wish i could stop people from going to theaters
reviews.content: This is by far the worst animated film i have ever seen, the plot may sound familiar because we have seen it in the Lego Movies, Minions and pretty much any other recent film about using brands to make easy money.Remember when making animated movies was all about moral lessons and making the audience have fun? well, this movie is just another strategy for making profit by just using a silly trend. Of course they don't give a damn about the quality, the story or the characters, they only made it because EMOJI is a word that sells and you can notice when they can't shut up about advertising Dropbox, Just Dance and other apps in the movie, you pretty much are PAYING to see a 90 minute add.Hey Sony, what's next?, The MEME movie? a movie with exactly the same plot as any other garbage animated film but with all memes having fun together?, the main character will be misunderstood and trying to find it's way into the society of memes? all with different emotions and feeling that represent each meme (the good one, the evil one, the sarcastic one, the funny one)?, with the ending being about the main character being accepted by everyone?

Save money and more than an hour of your lives by not booking a seat for this movie!

Honestly, this movie is probably the worst I've ever seen. The whole idea is creative and could've been such an amazing movie but it was lacking a lot of things, like the plot and dialogue. The visuals, characters and setting was terrific. It was visually appealing and all the apps and emojis were very imaginative and well done, but the dialogue was cringe and the plot was confusing. A lot of it didn't make sense, and the good parts of the movie sadly don't make up for the bad. I don't think this is a suitable movie for young kids as it involves social media and a lot of other things that only teens would understand but it is a pretty lame movie for older kids and adults. Don't waste your time and money on it!

I can't believe it...I cannot believe this - You have cancelled the Popeye animated movie for this?!First, the plot makes no sense. One character says, "pLaY iT cOoL sEnd An EmoJI" This movie's literally about emojis, and you, Sony, just wanted to make more money.Hi-5 is TOO OBNOXIOUS TO BE FUNNY! He's nothing but annoying and a complete idiot; he even acts like he's 5.Second, all the 6-10 star reviews are written by a 10-year-old. They don't know how bad this movie is and you don't even need an hour and thirty-one minutes of your life wasted - just watch Wreck-It-Ralph instead...Third: The characters. My God they're all terrible.The Main Character: More than one emoji. Aren't you supposed to be a "MEH" emoji? And you show multi-expressions? No emoji does that!Hi-5: Like I said he's obnoxious and annoying. He was too helpless to me in this movie that I fell asleep because of him in the first 15 minutes.Jailbreak: At least her voice was good, but was also bad and a complete moron. She and the others go on stupid adventures through social media such as Instagram, Just Dance, Messages, etc.Poop: What were the creators thinking?! They chose Patrick Stewart as that character?! Hell, the toilet joke wasn't funny. Not a single person laughed.Smiley: She's SO annoying in this one and makes me want to throw up. Even her face looks terrible.That High-school kid: Although he has a crush on another girl, he couldn't find a way to confess her. But he sends this weird emoji we haven't seen on our phones. Really?; Even Nokia phones don't have that!The other Sony movies were enjoyable, had a soul and heart, and relaxing and heart warming. And what does The Emoji Movie do? TAKES ALL THE HEART AND ADDS BAD STUFF! And if they didn't cancel the previous movie they animated, they wouldn't get more hate.Do yourself a favour - DON'T WATCH THIS GARBAGE.First Foodfight then this. SMH.
Instant classic only boomers wouldn't give 10/10. Character are unforgettable and relatable

reviews.review_title: Almost As Bad As People Say
reviews.content: There's nothing I could say that hasn't already been said. The only reason I didn't give this movie a 1/10 is because the animation is actually good.

reviews.review_title: Not that bad!! Give it a shot!
reviews.content: I can't believe how people are giving this such terrible reviews. It's a cartoon. It was not supposed to be a highly acclaimed film or some great hit.It's fun to watch and has a good story line and great visuals! Sure, besides using emojis, the plot may be less unique, but it was still a fun watch for day when you have nothing else to do. Most people giving this a 1 star review are being dramatic and overcritical, especially given that I've seen much worse movies in the theaters that ended up with 5 or 6 stars on IMBD. Also please ignore the 10-star reviews from trolls who are trying to be funny.Bottom line: Don't expect an instant classic and you will enjoy this! Give it a shot!

reviews.review_title: Actually better than Ralph Breaks the Internet
reviews.content: The Emoji Movie is not good. Let's get that right out of the way. But I think it's notable for paving the way for a much more beloved recent film, Ralph Breaks the Internet. The plot and tone of each film is incredibly similar but the latter had the Disney princesses wearing sweatpants so everyone thought that was good and this was really bad? In reality, both films are scrounging at the bottom of the barrel as far as kids flicks go. I can't totally pan either one because they, unfortunately, both kept my daughter's attention to varying degrees. The bar is low. Sorry, sweatpants princesses. Ideally, one would stay away from both of these on the general principle that they--apart from trying to ruin your brain with their maddeningly fast-paced content--they fall prey to being straight-up, pro-consumerist garbage. The Emoji Movie is honestly probably more annoying than Wreck-It Ralph 2 but because it's premise is, by default, more original, I would give it the slight nod as far as my recommendations go.

I always thought this movie would be stupid but I put it on for my daughter and we're both big fans. I have it on at least once a day, she really seems to love it. If you like puns and don't have a stick up  this is the movie for you.

My 3 1/2 yr old niece & I came across this movie on Netflix!! She laid down and watched the whole movie with me, & we continuously laughed!!This was a very cute movie & one that as a Mom of a toddler, I was able to enjoy very much as well .

reviews.review_title: Terrible, but what did you expect?
reviews.content: So someone actually thought that making a movie about emojis would be a good idea, but either they tried to make it bad or they tried and the team behind the movie had no idea what they were doing. So there is 1 main plot to this movie and 2 sub plots and the main one is an emoji that is a meh, but he has other emotions which is considered bad to the others, so he sets off on a quest with a retarded high five emoji and some kind of hacker that really serves no point in it. One of the sub plots is about a teen who is trying to send the right emoji to his crush which is cringy just thinking about it. And while meh is gone, his boring parents talk about separating. Im not joking those are the actual plot points in this movie.Know before i get into the abominations of this movie, let me just say that if you want to get some friends together and you want to make fun of a movie that is so terrible, then go see this (BUT NOT IN THEATERS NO NO NO NO GOD NO) i saw this movie online for free and that is the only reason i am not giving this movie a 1 star rating because me and my drunk friends at least had fun ripping on it. Anyway there is a lot of things i hated but i don't want you to read 8 paragraphs so ill make it short. The plots are messy and stupid, the characters are terrible and some actors are wasted in this film like Patrick Stewart, the jokes are cringy and flat out laughable but not in a good way, the film tries to teach meaningless themes like feminism and it serves no purpose in the film, the movie is boring, the editing feels like it was done by an 11 year old, And worst of all the movie is one big advertisement. In the end The Emoji Movie is a terrible movie for all ages and it will probably please those who are morbidly obsessed with emojis, but i mean come on who thought this movie was actually gonna be good. And to think that Sony canceled Popeye for this idiotic trash makes me sick to my stomach. 2/10 or F Easily the worst movie i have seen in the last 5 years.
There's a scene where they all get killed by an emoji coming out of the screen.

Be checking it out, my fellow millennials! This movie is so #hashtagRELATABLE. All the kids these days are constantly using "the machines" so the #HIP #COOL #SWAG people at Sony made a AWESOME movie about those devices those kids these days are constantly on! In this movie all the kewl kids use the cellular devices to communicate with their peers. One young man starts telegramming his crush with these mobile phone hieroglyphics that the youths refer to as "emojis". Suddenly, we all get to learn how that technology really works. In my day, we had a rotary phone that took 2 minutes just to dial, AND WE LIKED IT. But these days the children's have an entire city called Textopolis in those dang devices. Sony seems to really be in touch with the youths of today with all the #edgyyy #relatable jokes and puns in this movie.
I only gave it a 2 star because animation is decent

After paying as little money as I could get away with to rent it, I can safely say that The Emoji Movie is the worst movie I have ever seen, and I've seen some absolutely terrible films. The concept is absurd and an insult to every millennial alive, the plot is nonsensical, the writing is atrocious and incredibly unfunny, you can easily find every animated movie trope from the last 20 years, every character is a stereotype, the score is so forgettable that I literally can't remember a single thing about it, the way the fictional world works is never explained, and frankly, I'm amazed that Sony even had to guts to call this a film. This is, at best, 90 minutes of advertising I paid to watch. The product placements are so blatant and insulting that I almost gave up halfway through the film. Also, keep in mind these advertisements were targeted at young children who can't see them for the slap in the face that they are. Finally, as a large Star Trek fan, it was soul crushing to see Patrick Stewart completely ruined by filmmakers who were most certainly drunk throughout the entire production of this abomination. Please, if you value your sanity, your morality, or your brain cells, do not watch this movie. There is no artistic value of any kind here; there is only pain.

The entire movie (excluding the short at the beginning and the credits) is only about 78 minutes long. It's not even feature length. The Hotel Transylvania short at the beginning was funnier than this whole movie. Gene is an emoji which has many emotions, he is a glitch basically, and the smiley emoji isn't happy that he made the wrong face when Alex (the phone's user) selected him. Alex is sad because he doesn't know how to talk to the girl he likes. Even though he has her phone number. So Gene (why he is given a name yet 90% of the other emojis don't have a name I have no idea) decides to see Jailbreak, a hacker which can make him just feel "meh". She will help him get to the cloud where she can be free and she can turn him into meh. Hi Five tags along for some reason. To get to The Cloud they have to get to DropBox. Not kidding. But before that they look at Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and Candycrush. They spend 7 minutes playing Cnadycrush. And another 5 minutes playing Just Dance. I wish I was making this up but I'm not. Hi 5 gets deleted with the Just Dance App and ends up in the trash. Gene wants to save him. Spoiler alert, Jailbreak is the princess emoji. She and Gene carry on and go to Spotify and ride the music waves. Then they get to Dropbox after being chased by malware the smiley emoji sent out. But don't worry, Jailbreak told us that Dropbox is secure!!! They upload to the cloud and fly on the twitter bird to save High 5 and then they all dance at the end and everyone in the audience loses their will to live.

The movie setting (the Wallpaper, how the apps works for the characters, etc) is very unpredictable and cool. The characters themselves are very funny (especially Hi-5). The only flaw this movie have for me is that the flow is a little rushed. It's just been, what, 20 mins into the movie and the conflict is already unfolding.
