So I've just watched this with my kids and expected to have to claw my eyes out or catch up with some sleep while it was on. But its not that bad.from the reviews I've seen and the universal 1/10 rating i literally expected this to be unwatchable, or extremely poorly made to the point of looking like a mess - spykids 3 or something. Its about the same kind of level as any of a dozen direct to DVD 'specials' I've seen this year.Its basically a budget retread of the lego movie. Emojis try to escape from a smartphone by crossing through apps on the homescreen to get to 'the cloud' which they will access via dropbox. Some of the product placement is fairly crass but no worse than the lego movie and not as bad as many reviews I've read have implied. The characters get trapped in versions of candy crush and lets dance. Quite a lot of it is negative to the apps themselves (ie facebook) and i was surprised a key feature of the story was a 'pirate' app called 'jailbreak'.Its a kids movie, my kids (4 and 7) enjoyed it though one jump scare did get to my 4 year old (a robot unexpectedly grabs a character and snatches them off screen). They enjoyed it, as did the majority of the audience. Only one family left early and thats not unusual in a family screening. I've only ever fallen asleep during one movie in my life (wesley snipes the art of war). This is infinitely better than that movie and that movie gets 5.7? Go figure.

reviews.review_title: Thankfully, I already had low expectations for The Emoji Movie
reviews.content: While I didn't like the movie, I can't call The Emoji Movie disappointing. Not because it was good, but because I didn't have very high expectations for it anyway. I didn't think it was going to be very good, and it wasn't. This movie follows Gene, a meh emoji with multiple facial expressions and emotions, and his two friends High Five (the pointless comic relief) and Jailbreak. Obviously, the cast isn't very good, with a completely pointless characters and two rather flat ones. What bothers me is that the writers didn't take the time to even develop or come up with interesting characters. Gene is the stereotypical outcast because he's different than everyone else, and Jailbreak is the rebel princess (who didn't see THAT twist coming?). The rest of the emojis contributed nothing to the plot and were only there to make a few corny emoji puns. The only character I can say was decent was Smiler. I liked how the movie portrayed her as unstable and a bit unnerving.It's pretty obvious this movie was made solely to advertise random phone apps such as Candy Crush, Spotify, Just Dance (which, as far as I know, isn't even an app), YouTube, Dropbox, Instagram, and so many more. 90% of the movie was just one giant advertisement seeing as half the story follows the main characters hopping from one app to another.However, as bad as characters and product placement are, the overall plot of the movie is possibly the worst part. There's just not much originality to it, with most of the plot taking ideas from more successful movies such as Wreck-it-Ralph, Inside Out, and The Lego Movie to name a few. And their message (to express yourself as a unique individual), while important, has been done many times before and was poorly executed in The Emoji Movie. The human lead, Alex, a teenager in his first year of high school, has trouble expressing himself. But at the end of the movie, how does Alex accomplish self expression? With the use of a multi-facial emoji! It's like the point of the movie is to show that self-expression can only be achieved through the use of your phone.Overall, The Emoji Movie's only redeeming qualities are the antagonist and the animation (especially the scenery). Otherwise, it's just another cliché kid's movie and will soon be forgotten among some other forgettable animated movies.

Of course the kids might enjoy these types of films, but adults will find it stupid and predictable.

The Candy Crush thing? WHAT THE HECK WE'RE THE FILMMAKERS THINKING WHEN THEY WROTE THIS MOVIE OR PUT THIS INTO PRODUCTION?!!The only thing product placement wise that I didn't mind were YouTube and somewhat, Just Dance, but that isn't enough. And why is there a Star Trek reference in here? The only thing this got out of me was a few chuckles because I couldn't believe my eyes.If i had sat through this back in 2017, this would've made my worst films of the year.Grade: JD GOMFC (Get out of my face, Emoji Movie)THIS MADE MORE MONEY THAN BLADE RUNNER 2049! SOMEHOW!!
Absolutely amazing i have no wrds. just sooooooo good

This is a long ad my parents had to pay for. My little siblings wanted to see it and so it was purchased. My little sister was in love with it, my little brother called it meh. My mom spent like 20 minutes making popcorn to avoid the film. I personally was waiting for the phone to wipe so I could recover my lost brain cells.

When it was first announced, I thought that the emoji movie was just some elaborate April fools prank. Clearly, I was wrong. This film was a steaming pile of human waste. It was a pandering, cliché mess of a movie that makes "The Room" look like a masterpiece. To be frank, I only watched the emoji movie because I was expecting it to be so bad that it was actually comical. Unfortunately, this movie's horrific nature is due to the immense blandness of the plot, the characters, the visuals. The plot is full of clichés, as are the characters. Each character is one dimensional and lacks nuance. Even the main character, Gene, is made to be a nuanced character who breaks the mold. However, he ends up being a one dimensional rest like everyone else. The visuals are uninspired. Every frame is full of colors, but frankly, the vibrancy just makes everything look like a can of children's medicines. Now would be an appropriate time to to make an analogy: Assume the Emoji Movie is a blank canvas, it is basic, pandering and cliché. Assume the Room is a child's drawing. A child's drawing, although inherently bad, is still more valuable than a blank canvas. The former is personal and is something that the child worked hard to make. The latter can be bought at a store and was built by a machine. In essence, the Emoji movie was made by a machine, made in a formulaic way. It lacks emotion, subtlety, or nuance. If you have a few hours on your hands, don't watch this film, watch something that was made by an artist, or even a generic human. Or even something made by yourself.

1970: In 2017 we will have flying cars! 2017: THE EMOJI MOVIE!I can't believe that Sony would create such a horrific film. My eyes are forever scarred. This movie is an atrocity and is just 🅱️ad. WHERE WAS THE 🅱️ emoji!!?? Its unbelievable that people would pay to see a movie like this. I already was starting to believe there was no god, but now I know there isn't. This movie is the opposite of 💯. Don't spend money on this unless you want cancer.

(And that was also an incredibly horrible movie as well.)I'm not going to put any spoilers in this review. It's not worth more of my time. reviews.review_title: A Masterpiece of Cinema! The Greatest Film of All Time!
reviews.content: Have you ever met someone and knew right away that they were the best thing that's ever happened to you? It feels strange because you've lived your entire life without even knowing they existed, but you wonder how you survived for this long without them in your life. I can honestly say that I've just felt true love for the first, and probably last, time in my life. For the longest time, you've listened to songs singing about love and romance, but you were never able to relate to them. All of the sudden, you are able to connect with nearly every single word you hear on an emotional level. You think about them literally all the time and can't imagine a future without them. It's funny how the tiniest chance encounter can have such profound effects. I feel really terrible and heartbroken now because I have to come to terms with the fact that my one true love may soon be gone for some time. The worst thing in the world is finding out that they don't share your feelings back. I know that this may seem like a lot of work just to express my feelings, but trust me, I would do so much more to show my love if I could. I am, of course, referring to The Emoji Movie!That is why it's about time I give my one true love, The Emoji Movie, the affection it deserves. Ever since I was introduced to The Emoji Movie on July 28, 2017, I became an entirely new person. I was just a kid hopelessly in love with something I knew would never return my feelings.I feel confident in saying that The Emoji Movie truly is the greatest film of all time. I don't think anything will ever make me believe otherwise (except for The Emoji Movie 2, of course). Not only is Gene, the multi-expressional Emoji, the greatest character ever put to film, he is also the most emotionally (dare I say, "emojinally?") complex and three-dimensional character I have ever seen. I praise Tony Leondis for effectively being able to make me care so much about a character that I would not normally give the time of day. The Emoji Movie has made me a better person because it taught me that there are always more layers to people. The Emoji Movie has the amazing message that it is OK to be yourself in an oppressive world that arbitrarily forces you to be one thing for your entire life. I have so much newfound respect for all Emojis now, especially the "Meh" (😒) Emoji. The plot of The Emoji Movie is too precious, unpredictable, creative, intelligent, entertaining, and enthralling to spoil for you here, but I will say it will have you on the edge of your seat for the entire 86 minutes no matter how many times you've already watched it. Every time I see it in theaters I buy a popcorn, but never even touch it because I am too focused on The Emoji Movie to notice anything going on outside of that screen. Films like The Emoji Movie are so special, they offer great educational value to children of all ages AND they offer a great, engaging, intense theater experience; something that sad excuse of a film, Dunkirk, couldn't offer. When I first walked out of my first Emoji Movie screening, I was shaking because I had just been on the greatest emotional roller coaster of my life. People may try and use Rotten Tomatoes, Metacritic, or IMDb as a credible source to justify why they think this masterpiece is bad. I am more than happy that The Emoji Movie is receiving rocky reviews from the start. Obviously it deserves 100% everywhere and from everyone, but some of the greatest films of the past were all miserably misunderstood at the time of their initial release. Like 2001: A Space Odyssey, many people who lack the brain capacity necessary to comprehend such important, life-changing messages presented in The Emoji Movie walked out of the theater. Citizen Kane, which is no longer considered the greatest film of all time since the release of The Emoji Movie July 28, 2017, was widely panned by audiences for being too progressive for its time. I will be waiting for the day when film schools all around the world show their students The Emoji Movie as an example of how to thematically, technically, and cinematically make a perfect film. Don't even get me started on the comedy aspect of it! The Emoji Movie is also the funniest movie ever! It has non-stop humor that makes me laugh every time I see it. Sometimes, I laugh so hard that I almost choke or pass out. Somehow, I was laughing for 106 minutes straight even though The Emoji Movie is only 86 minutes! Some of the jokes just stick with you long after the movie ends and you burst out laughing whenever you think of them. If you didn't notice, I tried to keep my Emoji usage here to a minimum. You may be wondering why I am doing this if I am such a big fan of The Emoji Movie. Well, that is because I learned from The Emoji Movie that not all Emojis were made to fit into only one emotion. I prefer to understand the Emoji's deeper feelings and emotions that may be contrary to the assumed emotion they are stereotyped to represent. I seriously pity anyone who uses Emojis when they haven't seen The Emoji Movie because they can't understand the deeper emotions the Emojis experience like us Emoji Movie fans can. Those people can only take the Emojis at face value.

I kept hearing how bad this movie was but wanted to see it for myself. Although it was cringey and cliche I actually enjoyed it. It started off rough but the ending was good. My nieces and nephews thought it was ok and that's all that really matters since it's targeted to kids.

Is there really no creativity left? Is there no shame in releasing such a schmata? Is there really no topic one could pick besides retarded emojis? Stop. Please, please stop. No more. Because if there will be more, then the world will turn into a 100% version of the world in "Idiocracy", and the next big movies will be called "A**", and the next big TV show will be "Ow, my balls!". And it goes beyond "movies" like this - it's as if 9/10 big movies that come out are just literally cinematic fastfood - no thought given. Literally, none at all. "Just make something!"

This was one of the worst films I have ever seen, and definitely the worst film I have taken the kids to for one simple reason.My kids didn't laugh once.They watched it, quietly. They even smiled. But no laughs. None.In fact, there weren't any laughs that I could hear from anyone else in the cinema.The plot, wafer thin as it is, centers on the notion that getting what you want, rather than need, is what matters. The main example of this is the High Five character (perfectly voiced by James Corden, and this is not a compliment BTW). His arc is to be adored and popular again, but there is no conflict at all. TJ Miller's "Meh" follows a similar flat-line progression of "characted not happy, expresses what they want, gets it" The hacker character also has little to no driving action either.And the simultaneous real-world plot involving a boy and girl? Forget about it. I think the filmmakers did and then remembered and hastily crow-barred a useless race-against-time final act that (SPOILER ALERT) in itself, makes no sense whatsoever (i.e. a kid that can't wipe their own phone? C'mon!)This was a colossal waste of talent (apart from James Corden) and deserves to be consigned to the bargain bin.

In this loving story about a young face forced to assimilate into face society, learns that loving yourself is more important even if that means everyone wants you dead. And they only stop wanting you dead when you do something nice for them. Good Moral. Great Movie. I'll show it to my 36 children. I give it 7 poop emoji's out 10.

How to teach ignorance to children, a poop movie and story for kids 0-6 years old. Already from trailer it was understood that is was horribile.
The worst movie I ever seen in my life.

I feel sorry for the people who actually went to the cinemas and watched this 'movie'. I feel even sadder for the voice actors. This movie was just a big step back in their career. Who even thinks of this hecking storyline, you seriously have to hate the world and all of its beauties to create such an abomination of a movie. I've seen the movie ATM which was a movie about a friggin ATM bullcrappery that made me search for the Director and find him and ask him how can someone make such a shitty movie and it was a better movie than this.

Other than being an advertising tool and predictable & mediocre story, there's no reason to trash it. Like the main character aspired to be, this is just "meh," which in no way is the worst movie of any genre or era. Film "critics" are so anti-conventional and anti- pop culture that they're hating for hating's sake, and then you get those pretentious middle-aged people and "meta" youngsters to follow them.
Simply put, it's a cliché coming-of-age story about a boy who doesn't fit in and cannot meet the societal expectations. Being a failure & outcast, he manages to befriend a person who accepts him and helps him find a possible solution. Eventually he meets a girl who's also not a social norm and helps him embrace who he is.This movie is not hard to understand, not repulsive or atrocious, and not an abomination; on top of that it has somewhat imaginative visual aspects. There are many worse movies out there (Woody Woodpecker being the most recent one I watched), which may have ACTUAL nonsensical story, worse dialog, really REALLY bad acting, or poke-my-eyes-out special effects. This is not worth the 1 star rating or the 10/100, so quit your whining -_-

When I first heard about this movie I thought it could be fun and it won't take its self too seriously.
Anyways.After a year I finally got a chance to watch it. I must say this movie sucks. Even for a meh emoji this movie is a mehsucks.It felt like an unfinished prototype test movie for Disney's Inside Out.The movie is about....Its about....its about...umm.... an Emoji that isn't happy about being himself. So he sets off to do something and in the end I didn't care.Stay away from this movie if you know what's good for you. Allow me to watch these bad movies so you don't have to.

The humor is about as entertaining as watching cement dry,the characters are 1 dimensional and annoying,and the plot is from the STONE AGE.The target audience is kids such as myself but I don't see how even the youngest of the young could enjoy this potty/gross out humor infested rat nest. Not worth anything,let alone your money. Go buy a Pixar film and have actual JOY in watching it.

As others here have said, this film is really not a film at all but a movie length advertisement for smart phone apps that corporate America wants you and your children to download after you watch the "movie." It's just a shameless, cynical cash grab. Very sickening to say the least. Not only that, this film steals concepts from much better films such as Inside Out, Wreck-It-Ralph, and The Lego Movie. It's that unoriginal and lazy. I really feel particular disappointment in Patrick Stewart, whom I have enjoyed watching in the Star Trek franchise and the X-Men movies, but I guess even he is willing to sell his soul to play talking poop if the pay check is right. A shame.

The movie represents everything that i hate about the cinematographic industry the reused jokes, the obvious plot, the obvious marketing, all pull together into a big pile of sh*t. it's not only bad, it's evil it's a cringe machine on purpose just for the sake of money.if you watch this movie just put a bullet to your head pain will go away my friend.

reviews.review_title: This movie is like a manifestation of my life. its horrible but i still push on
reviews.content: You know a movie's horrible if viewing it makes you re-evaluate your life. I was tempted to run a psychological evaluation immediately after deciding to watch. Normally when you take a bathroom break you would want to go back as soon as possible. This was NOT the case. In fact, you'd gladly take as much time as possible away from the theater just to escape the soul-crushing horror that is the Emoji Movie.The audio and visuals that this film emits radiates worse than than that of the 1986 Chernobyl Disaster. Long-lasting side effects include mental breakdowns, night terrors and clinical depression. Overall, this "movie" is not for the faint of heart. Watch with caution.

Spider Man 1 and 2, and Spider Man homecoming. This one is the worst one. Even illumination animation is better, because though the don't make the best movies, you can somewhat know what they are just by looking at them. Sony's single digit IQ doesn't allow them to do this, so make a movie, where the characters are emotions. At least inside out does things to make them more complex than "He's happy, make him a happy emoji." Even Foodfight, the terrible movie, has characters creative ideas. No animated movie is worse than this, and this definitely made Steve Jobs roll over in his grave. Don't see this movie, unless you get to see it for free.

Its product placement is in your face and the characters are 1 dimensional. It is clear that people thought the premise was enough to make the film work and they didn't need to bother with plot, drama or decent jokes.But i still found it just about watchable, which is probably due to the amount of utter rubbish I have already watched in the last year.

I'M DONE!!!!! I am sick of how people are saying that the emoji movie is good, it's not! Can't you see the ratings and cringe in this movie? I'm done with Sony!

reviews.review_title: Ignore the haters. Emoji Movie is DA BOMB!
reviews.content: If the makers of Tuscan Milk and the creators of the Three Wolf Moon shirt decided to make a film. Emoji Movie would be the result. Bright, crisp fluid animation meets the modern-day version of Shakespeare (though nowhere nears as boring). The characters almost leap off the screen as they are so believable. Then, with such an all-star cast (including Stiffler's mom. STIFFLER'S MOM)The DVD and Blu-Ray sales are going to be OFF THE CHARTS! I would suggest pre-ordering whatever deluxe steelbook 4k edition now as to not disappointment little Bobby or Suzie on Christmas morning. In the meantime, I would suggest multiple rewatches. Heck, find a homeless person and take them with you to see this film. It is so awesome and life-changing that when they are through witnessing this triumph of entertainment, the will no longer be a hobo.I really wish I had more stars to give.
It came, it made more then the budget and left a sour taste in everyone's mouth after watching it, awful movie.

reviews.review_title: Before you see the movie, read this...
reviews.content: Overall I believe the movie creatively summed up the moral of "be yourself". This is an important lesson and was portrayed throughout. This is evident in the trailer so this is not a spoiler.I thought it was OK. The animation was quite good and there was some relatable and creative moments which I think was the only thing this movie had going for it. There was also some cheeky product placement which was very obvious however there were some funny relatable smart phone moments (not going into too much detail) that did make me chuckle... NOT laugh. (big difference).This movie is basically your cliché animated kids movie.. it has some humor that is slightly funny, a villain, and an end goal. I predicted the ending within the first 10 minutes of watching the film. I was right. There were so many opportunites missed with this film but I am surprised at the 1.5 average rating. I would have given it a bit more then that. Overall I do not recommend this movie and rather suggest you spend your money on one of the better movies out right now. cough cough (Dunkirk)
When I went to go watch it with my little cousin I literally did not want to watch it but I had to and it sucked idk why they wasted so much money on a lame movie.

The emoji movie I bet was a huge pile of wasted money for Sony, and I bet a lot of people regret buying this movie for their kids. James Corden is not meant to be an actor, and they flushed Sir Patrick Stewart down the toilet by giving him the roll as the poop.

reviews.review_title: So now we have to pay to see ads today uh?
reviews.content: Really disgusting movie, is only barely acceptable on the first 15 minutes, the remaining 70 minutes can be defined as glorified advertising.The visuals are perhaps the only acceptable thing about this movie, but who watch a movie expecting those to be good? And if you do then there are countless films do it better.The story progresses in a painfully slow way and is packed with filler, what else did you expect they? Have to make time for the perpetual advertising, also is very inconsistent and full of plot holes and things just don't make sense.The characters are annoying and very few aren't worth of hate.My most sincere condolences to the people paid the ticket price for a 85-minute long ad.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as some make it out to be
reviews.content: Okay, obviously people feel the need to be utterly sarcastic and ridiculous about tearing this movie down, but I didn't think it was that bad. Honestly people, there are worse movies, like Inside Out, Chicken Run, Angry birds and every recent live action Disney remake (Sorry, but the live action Beauty and the Beast, Aladdin, Lion King and the rest are pathetic).Is The Emoji Movie a cinematic masterpiece? No, but it has a decent (albeit predictable) storyline with a positive message (about embracing who you are). I would definitely choose this over some of the other garbage that passes for children's movies these days.

What can I say? Except, its terr-i-ble! Me being me, decided to just watch the ending on youtube, so I wouldn't waste my money on this garbage. Yep, its bad. Don't waste your money on this one. Tbh, I'd rather make love with a cat than spend money on this freak show. I mean, if you have a son or daughter that wants to see this, just take them to see the latest horror movie. Trust me, its for the best.
Best movie ever to exist. Watch this before you decide to hate it.

reviews.review_title: Playing with my fidget spinner was more entertaining
reviews.content: This movie has absolutely no entertainment in it what so ever. Remember when everyone played with their fidget spinners? All it did was spin round and you were supposed to watch it. Not entertaining at all. However it's much doing that was a lot more fun that watching this waste of time. No I did not walk of the theater (although I felt like doing it), I had to this atrocity until the end. I gave the Emoji Movie a chance and I regretted it, HARD. It's wonderful background and animation however might be one of the only advantages about the film. The scenery and visuals are stunning in all seriousness. The Emoji Movie offers very little entertainment, it's original and it's a waste of time. Save your money instead of going out to see this garbage. I'll just keep playing with my fidget spinner. F**K THE EMOJI MOVIE!!!

This movie ain't it y'all. Wasted potential, voice actors, and money. I don't think this should've been made. There are better animated movies that show important parts of a kid/ teen's life in a fun and exciting way. Inside out, for example! That is a fantastic movie that depicts the human brain with really exciting ideas (ex. Train of thought, emotions, memories and more!). The emoji movie just fell way below the belt. Feel free to watch if you'd like however! I like to hate-watch this movie occasionally.
If I could give this movie a 0 i would! This movie was so boring that I slept in the middle of it and I NEVER sleep through movies! I wasted my $8 on this horrible movie. DON'T WATCH IT!!

This movie attempts to be a satire on how modern day generations are constantly using their phones, but it fails in every way. I gave this a 3/10 as apposed to a 0/10,1/10 or 2/10 due to the fact that it's a fun movie to rip on with friends. But it's is still a horrible movie and the worst animated movie of 2017 and arguably the worst movie of that year. It's worth your time for 1 or 2 viewings but afterwords let your blue-ray collect dust...

reviews.review_title: Lack of emotion in a film about emotions
reviews.content: The Emoji Movie is one of the most hated films in modern cinema. And boy, I can totally see why. I'm not saying this is the absolute worst movie I've ever seen (oh believe me, I have seen WAY WORSE), but this is still a horrible animated film. The writing is absolutely awful. It's like they didn't even TRY to put any sort of effort in the script. It's an obvious ripoff of 3 animated films MUCH better than this film: Wreck-It Ralph, The LEGO Movie and Inside Out. The characters are unlikable and very mean-spirited, while others are just dull and forgettable.The visuals were okay, but other than that The Emoji movie is a heap of unoriginality, and is just plain awful. Do not watch this movie. All those little criticisms you've been hearing about this film are correct. Avoid at all costs!

But anyway getting back to this the animation is atrocious.Characters: This all I will say the characters in this movie are unlikable characters they are people you just hate because of the personality of the characters as well as them being nothing but brain dead idiots and this is as bad of if not worse than Home On the Range with its characters being annoying unlikable characters. OMG high five is the animated version of Jar Jar Binks he annoyed the sh@t of me. Oh one thing I need to get out of the way this movie is nothing but a giant PRODUCT PLACEMENT MOVIE! Honeslty people this 86mins piece of garbage is nothing but product placement I could go on all day but I don't want to talk about it anymore. So Tony Lenodis and Sony Pictures Animation go F@ck yourselves and F@ck of back to where you come from.

Truly awful. It's genuinely painful to watch. This movie is not one of those it's so bad that it's good, no it's. just. the. worst.
Also I have never seen a movie with so much advertisement in it? Feels more like watching an ad than a movie.
Not sure why there are so many haters for this film. It's great! And it's funny! I love watching it especially with my kids. Great message!

reviews.review_title: This Movie Doesn't Count As A Movie
reviews.content: this movie doesn't count as a movie, it's an Advertisement its advertised garbage meant to sell products. anybody working on this movie besides the animation team that made this not only look good but also interesting and doesn't give off a cheap vibe like the boss baby. all the jokes and dialogue was uninteresting and forced and was most likely written by executives in an hour with there out of touch delusions of what a teenager, in fact, treating them as a demographic, not people. the voice acting was dull and uninteresting. the cast was brought in to get names on the IMDb page the acting is passable at best but what annoys me is how many traits were stolen from CGI kids movies from the past 5 years ranging from wreck it Ralph to the Lego movie but two things these movies did better than the emoji movie is integrity and understanding of their audience a great example is the Lego movie, the movie's substance was studied heavily down to the movement of the characters and the movie could stand on its own as a refreshing, creative and entertaining movie. there was so much more I could have talked about but I'm going to leave this review but I'm going to leave this review with a score of 100 dead writers that wrote this movie. this movie doesn't deserve a real score.

I'm just doing something to help other humans, don't watch this "movie", and just be on your merry way do something more interesting and simply better. Hopefully this is not the end of Western culture. The lack of pacing and an absolute absence of plot depth made watching this a tiring exercise of patience. When I wasn't cringing at the stupidly unfunny jokes and product placement, I found myself rolling my eyes at the ridiculously predictable dialogue. When I wasn't rolling my eyes, I was desperately checking the running time- which I did about every ten or fifteen minutes. Once it was finally over, I lied face-down on my bed, willing any memories of having watched The Emoji Movie to leave my now much smaller brain. However, I can now live a far happier life knowing that I will never have to subject my ears and eyeballs to this movie again.

reviews.review_title: Bring your bleach, it doesn't have to be your bleach
reviews.content: I am lost for words. I didn't pay to see this so-called "movie" but I still want a refund of some sort. When I watched this "movie" I obviously wasn't expecting anything good but I just wanted to laugh at how sh*t it is but, my God, what I felt watching this was 1 hour and 25 minutes of Satan throwing his sh*t at me. I might as well just have received a kick in the nuts, at least the pain from that would fade! I remember my dad telling me about the times he went to see The Exorcist and A Clockwork Orange in the early 1970's and when he left the cinema, he and the rest of the audience were greeted by members of the Salvation Army at the cinema entrance giving everyone at the screening leaflets containing phone numbers to psychiatrists you should ring if you were psychologically effected by the film's content. I can definitely say I'll be needing therapy over the next few weeks to get rid of the horrible images of cringy "poop" jokes, awkward unfunny lines and the endless product placements of iPhone apps erased from my mind.No doubt there will be people trying to defend this *cough* "movie" by saying "It's a kids movie, what do you expect!" No. There are plenty of kids movies from both past and recent times like The Lion King,Toy Story, Inside Out and Wreck It Ralph (which btw are movies this film rips off) which the makers actually put thought, effort and care into their project and not some cheap lifeless unfunny 85 minuet advert for social media, Facebook, candy crush and other phone apps. AVOID!

reviews.review_title: Don't be fooled, this "movie" is terrible
reviews.content: "It's just a kids film, you don't have to be to harsh on it" An average excuse from people who don't understand the power of animation. A medium that let's your imagination fly with emotional and powerful movies, with great messages and great different styles, and what did Sony Pictures Animation offered to us? An 88-minute evil, stupid, manipulative and offensive commercial. Yes, it's a commercial, not a movie. Because the film is so focused to promote apps and emojis instead of thinking how to make this movie work.People might be overrating the Lego movies, but it's justified. As much as it's an excuse to sell Legos, it had an actual creative team that thought a good script first, and then how to sell it. Same case with Toy Story, they had a creative and inspired team that loved animation and cared about this concept as silly it sounds, and it worked.The emoji movie doesn't want to be creative, funny or at least unique in any aspect. It's your typical "be yourself" movie but with characters that are mean spirited with no personality, with a story that makes no sense and with really bad morals about treating the rest of people. This is a "movie" that embraces the smartphones and apps and tells you that you should depend on your phone instead of talk with real people and live the real life.This is a "movie" that manipulates you with pop songs, random and stupid jokes, bad animation and awful dialogue to buy everything they offer in this commercial and to make you think that the things they say in this movie is "profund".This is a "movie" that says that it's OK to be yourself, but you need to break rules and do nothing to fix your problem unless it's buying a smartphone.This is a "movie" that it's already dated by the time to review is posted, that shows no compassion to the kids, that treats the audience like stupid people who went to see this and insults every piece of minimum of cleverness just to the sake to sell toys about emojis.Sony Pictures Animation failed so bad to make this movie a franchise and it shows they don't know how to make a good animated movie, because they are more focused on how to market this towards children.It's a waste of time and no other kid should see this by its own merits ever again. It needs to be banished from the history of film making and from the art of animation.You want to show something for your kids? Let them watch anything else instead of Emoji movie. Because it doesn't teach anything good, it's mean spirited, it's too stupid to be taken seriously and it's too annoying and uninspired to be a comedy.Don't watch it ironically, don't watch it for the memes, don't watch it as a family film, just avoid everything that it's related with this horrible product. Trust me, you'll regret if you see it.I've warned you.

The Emoji Movie is the movie we should bury in time capsules for future generations to watch and be inspired by it. This awe inspiring, motivational film deserves the highest of ratings.

As you can tell I loved this movie it was very funny and interesting I'm joking I would rather k I l l m y s e l f then watch this ever AGIAN.

Animation: This is only good thing about this movie. I like their effort toward the animation. It was bright and colorful. However, its not enough to prevent from become one of the worst movie of all time. (It's not the worst movie ever) Character: Every emoji have one facial expression throughout the entire movie. All of these character are stereotypes. Poop was voice by Patrick Stewart. Who is one of the famous emoji. I don't know who Poop is. I try to dig deep into that character, but I can't because there was no character development. Smiler who has a creepy smile who was the main villain of this movie. But, I don't find that she was that evil. she try to make sure that all emoji are perfect. Gene is the one who mess up the text cause Smiler to send the robot to delete him because of malfunction. Gene the meh face who has multiple expressions that no emojis has expect his father meh later throughout the movie. Hi-five Gene's friend who was annoying, unlikable, unfunny, and love to tell jokes throughout the movie. Jailbreak who has the ability to hack the phone in order to get Drop box and bring Gene back to just meh. and then later, she was revealed that she was a princess emoji. However, her character design was a ripoff of Wyldstyle from the Lego Movie. The character development was terrible. The character was bland, tasteless, mindless, mean-spirited, and unlikable. Story: The writing was terrible. The joke was too simple and it's not funny. There some joke like Gene tell Hi-five don't do it after Hi-five spit out of candy cone and then later he put the candy back the mouth. There's one where poop and his son said "We're number 2" Story was Mindless, Boring, and predictable. Also the story was a Rip-off from Inside out and Wreck it Ralph like Ralph jump from game to game while emoji jump from app to app. Inside out like send the wrong feelings while emoji send the wrong face. The plot twist was very weak because There was no backstories. It did not explain How Gene and his father has more than one facial expression. Plot: After Gene send the wrong face to Alex's Crush, he went to the meeting room with Smiler. She sense that Gene was malfunction. She send the robot to delete Gene so the phone can return to normal. Gene and Hi-five escape the world with no explanation. and jump into the app to avoid the robot as they try to delete Gene. They Jump into app to app (troll, YouTube, candy crush, just dance, and Music wave.) until they get to the Dropbox (that was the main plot of this story.) where they about to change Gene back to normal, but change their mind and decided not do it and then later Gene got captured by robot sending Gene to go after his friend to go save him. After the Smiler defeated, gene try to send the right face before the phone got completely delete and then Alex changed his mind and then decided to keep the phone. Then at the end they did the Dance like they did in Just dance app. Voice actor: they bring the most famous actor like Patrick Stewart, T.J. Miller, Jake T. Austin, James Corden, etc. which was great, but the script was poorly written which give the actor poor effort and feel bad about. Overall: This movie was terrible. Possibly one of the worst movie of 2017. It was Bad written, lack of character development, unfunny, Rip-off, mindless, and boring. This movie was some reasons why this should not be exist in the first place. They got lucky for the box office, however their lucks ran out because of negative reviews by critics and audiences. It could be nomination for razzie award of 2017. Because of that, There's 0% chance to make a nomination for the Oscar award. Strong tip: Don't watch it and also don't buy the DVD.

reviews.review_title: The worst animated movie of the decade
reviews.content: this is honestly one of the worst films I have ever seen. When you look at films like Norm of the North and Foodfight, sure they're bad, but they can still be funny and entertaining to watch because of how bad they are. This is not the case with this movie. This film is downright atrocious and there is literally no enjoyment to be had with it in any sense. Tony Leondis has seriously sunken to a new low, Sony Pictures Animation has entered a new gateway to hell, and Sony can now add this to their large track record of god awful films.I could dissect the story, but whats the point? If you've seen Wreck it Ralph, Inside Out, and the Lego Movie, then there are no surprises for you here. The plot is predictable from beginning to end. There's this emoji that's different, hes shunned upon i guess, he messes everything up, he goes to fix it, he teams up with an annoying idiot and an obnoxious feminist, he learns to be himself, then goes home and fixes everything. DA END. whole movie. No surprise twist, nothing unique. Just a pile of better movies shoved in a broken blender. The conflict of Alex deleting his phone is so contrived and baffles all logic, both with character actions and even the understanding of smartphones. This film is riddled with gaping plot holes as well. Why doesn't Alex turn the phone off or mute it if its causing him grief? Why don't the emojis just go around the apps instead of going through them? How does deleting gene stop Alex from deleting the phone? I could go on for ages about the plot holes, but honestly, they're completely obvious. There's also a god awful message about being yourself that's so shoehorned in that i honestly think I got a brain tumor from it.The characters in this film are horrendous. Gene is boring as hell and T.J miller clearly didn't care about giving a good performance. His character is unbelievably bland and he never goes through any kind of development or change. Hi-5 is one of the most insufferable "comic reliefs" i have ever seen. He never shuts up and never makes a good joke. Wyldestyle is an obnoxious feminist that spurts random feminist dialogue that doesn't fit and has literally nothing more to her character (they also make her a secret princess, not only making her a generic edgy teen, but also a bigger ripoff of venelope from Wreck it Ralph) . Smiler is a terrible villain that is just a ripoff of the fairy godmother from Shrek 2 mixed with a bit of Lord Business from the Lego Movie. Genes parents are also boring as heck, yet for some goddamn reason they have their own damn subplot. None of the Actors really cared about their performance. Literally the only good performance in this entire movie was Debi Derryberry as a shy emoji. Too bad that they didn't give their best actress an actually prominent role in this film.The soundtrack for this film is unbelievably bad. they use as much cringey music as they possibly can. The only part about this movie i thought had any effort other than Debi Derryberry was the animation.You can tell that the animators did the best they could to make this film look at least passable for theaters. The only negatives I have with the animation was the premise they had to work with and a couple of animation errors. At least they tried. Keep in mind that i almost never view animation above writing and storytelling, I'm just giving credit where its due.Overall, i think we have a pretty good contender for worst film of the year, and worst film of the decade. If you truly wish to see this abomination for yourself, make sure you do it illegally like i did. That's right, i downloaded this film off of the internet instead of watching it in theaters, a decision i will gladly take to my grave. Do not give Sony any of your well earned money.
This isn't that bad of a film, But I think they could do better! This film is about emoji's exploring the world of a phone, but it's not the worst movie!

reviews.review_title: No laughter. No fun. No hope.
reviews.content: I got forced to watch this one. I never wanted to- there was a small child relation who wanted to see a movie and this was the only one on in theaters when we were out. And by gum, was it bad.So, so bad.Bad enough it took me nearly three months just to work up the courage to write a quick review. The characters/actors... it was downright depressing hearing Sir Patrick Stewart, one of the finest actors alive, voicing a character named... Poop. Ugh. But generally, the characters were awful. The female lead, I wanted to fling her out a window. She's loathsome. The comedic sidekick was only made worse by James Corden's poor performance. And Eugene, the main lead, was just irritating and unappealing. The comedy is dreadful. The plot, frightful. The little girl I went with fidgeted the whole time; not once did she laugh or smile. She seemed bored. So don't try and claim 'kids will like it'. Kids are too good for this. This is an ad. A poorly done ad. Avoid it- you can't even MST3K this thing. Abandon all hope, ye who view.

reviews.review_title: I've never rated a movie in my life until now...

I'm sure you've read the other reviews on this website, so I feel there's not much else to be said. But since this movie was so bad, so terrible, so fundamentally flawed that it offended me to the very core of my soul and has left an irremovable blotch upon it, I felt obligated to give this movie the worse possible rating I could on the first movie-rating website that I could find. I awoke this morning, screaming (from nightmares), frantic to help the cause in making this "movie" the most infamous in all the four corners of the omniverse, due to the great injustice to the sense that this abomination has scarred me with. I will say this once, and I will say this now.DON'T WATCH THE EMOJI MOVIE.

reviews.review_title: How NOT to make an animated movie...
reviews.content: The Emoji Movie is an exciting adventure with memorable characters and complete with hilarious jokes and clever themes! Oh... sorry... that's what you WISH it was. This movie is so unbelievably terrible that Sony had to put SO much effort into Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse just to make up for this piece of Sir Patrick Stewart, who, by the way, plays a poop emoji. That's pretty much the movie in a nutshell. But if you want a more extensive answer, the movie is, boring, the characters are, forgettable, the script is, awful, the jokes are, cringe-worthy, the premise is, beyond stupid, the animation is, just OK, and the less I say about the bucket-load of product placement, the better. This may just be the worst animated movie of all time.

reviews.review_title: "I love the emoji movie! It's fantastic!" - SAID NO ONE EVER. *May contain a spoiler*
reviews.content: Let's cut to the chase here. This is an absolute waste of time. "the fate of all emoji's depends on these three unlikely friends who must save their world before it's deleted forever."Oh yeah, like that plot line has been used before. I was excited for this movie for about 10 seconds, when I had the guts to watch the trailer. After I watched the trailer, I swore on my life never to see that lifelong waste that is the emoji movie. I mean, who wants to see 90 minutes of cancer and boring plot lines that have been used about 9,000,000,000 times before? Not me. Not you. Not any of us.Heck, I bet you $20 or £20 that the film makers from Sony were drunk and one of them said: "Let's make a movie that will make everyone suicidal" and they said "Sounds good to me!" Long story short: Parents, I want you to swear on your child's life that you will NEVER EVER take them to the movies and pay a good amount of money to see this. I'm sure as soon as they get home they will kill themselves.In conclusion: "I love the emoji movie! It's fantastic!"- SAID NO ONE EVER.

reviews.review_title: One of the most BORING movies I've ever watched...
reviews.content: The only thing this movie truly has it going for is the (insultingly) beautiful animation. The visuals are stunning, everything is bright and colorful (for a kids movie, at least), and the emoji designs... are not really that bad.With that being said, watching this movie from start to finish was THOROUGHLY unenjoyable. The writing was some of the worst I've ever seen, the screenplay is horrible, the plot is bland & repetitive, the characters are annoying/forgettable, and the humor.. my god, the humor. The only, and I mean the ONLY times I've at least had a smile on my face was right at the beginning where we see that that the text emoticons are considered the elderly in their universe, and the Just Dance scene, as I love Just Dance. Also, what is with this movie and playing "Feel This Moment" by Pitbull and Christina Aguilera twice? I personally love the song but man, why couldn't they just pick a different song for the end?Overall, this movie really IS as bad as everyone said it was back in 2017. Don't show this to your kid(s). Show them Wreck-It-Ralph, The Lego Movie, or Inside Out instead. They'll have way more fun watching those movies instead of this boring mess.

If you want to find a better movie, I recommend either the 3 movies I've mentioned or the new 2017 releases. Otherwise, do not take anyone here or ask them to go to this movie!

reviews.review_title: The worst movie I have ever seen in my life!!!

I really wish I could give this movie a zero. There are literally no redeemable qualities. You cant even argue that the animation was good, because by this point, its impossible to make it "ugly" unless you screw up by godly proportions. The sad thing is, this movie wasn't a failure. It made crap loads of money, even though everyone hated it.Please stop ironically giving this product good reviews. And someone hand me a bottle of cyanide.

Isn't it great that today's generation might as well go much low than this with social media? Given that I didn't see it, what do I think of it? 💩? No, I believe that's already been done to death. "This movie sucks?" No that's not it either. From now on, I'm just gonna call it the epitome of losing faith in humanity until I find a description that verbally and physically fit the movie's crude, idiotic, and juvenile ideas of humor! I doubt that NOBODY laughs when I get to see it. What reality does this movie deserve to exist?! I really want to know, I'm genuinely curious at this point. In this reality, it's conventional wisdom that it takes a sane person to prevent this movie from being made. What am I saying, it's already been made! I've seen bad movies and it never bothers me at the slightest. I'd seen Pixels! Hell, I'd even seen the Ghostbusters reboot! I'd even seen Transformers and not the sequels! Now, I've officially learned by the doing the right thing of seeing Atomic Blonde instead of the Emoji Movie. This animated film with a target demographic of children may get to thank it's "lucky stars" every second of every day that whatever the writers sold their souls to was stupid enough to make a quick buck. I think I believe calling it a kids movie is not going to work anymore, because children deserve better instead of being bored. Definitely a fun movie for families to watch together

Sony Animation Studios have had a lot of big ideas lately, haven't they? Their two most recent contemporary classics hit home for sure. First, The Angry Birds Movie, and second, The Emoji Movie. Similar titles, vaguely similar plot lines and messages, and similar trend of soulless advertisements disguised as children's movies. I'm not going to pretend I had any high hopes for this movie, because I didn't. Sure, animation! Colorful, fluid animation! The only thing Sony is known for nowadays, other than dreadful movies, because they have the money to pump into it. Animation is all well and good, but, like Illumination Entertainment, money only goes so far. It's the equivalent of wrapping fecal matter in sparkly wrapping paper and being surprised and upset when people unwrap it and feel disgusted. So, to the point, I was going to be biased against it just from the subject of the movie, but I couldn't help thinking, in the back of my mind, there has to be at least SOMETHING that might be mildly amusing. SOMETHING that would make sense. SOMETHING that would make me think "hey, the people who wrote this are, in fact, humans and not aliens wearing flesh sacks who try to gather information from humankind to use it against them". But no such luck. T.J. Miller, the voice of Gene, the main character, mentioned it was the least worked-on animated film in history. He essentially states there was so little thought, time, and effort put into this flaming tin box of garbage and it shows - on the big screen, no less. The entire experience is so rushed and forced it leaves you wondering why anyone would bother with this in the first place. All the characters follow the exact same archtypes used in most generic animated movies, especially Angry Birds. Jerkish main character, ultra-goofy and agonizing sidekick, evil villain who seems charming and fun at first but turns out to be crazy, and cool, slick alternative chick. (At least we were spared from the last trope in TABM.) Everyone is devoid of personality other than their labels, which is ironic, considering the message of the movie is... be yourself, I suppose? People will love you for you? You'll get what you want in the end and not what you need? If you complain and cry and stomp your feet enough, you'll get a girlfriend, tons of fans, and a lifelong career? Who knows? Not Sony, that's for sure. Everything demonstrated in this movie is presented as an advertisement - and that's what it is, nothing more. It throws Sony-brand smartphones, Candy Crush, Spotify, Dropbox, Just Dance Now, so on and so forth at you because they can. It's shameless and embarrassing. Children won't understand this, parents aren't really going to feel charmed by it, and teens only watched this movie out of pure irony. The target demographic is incredibly difficult to pin down. It could possibly be preteens, but, again, I'm lost. It should be obvious already that a movie barely over an hour long would have plot holes, but this thing is so bogged down with them that it makes me shake in frustration. If Gene has parents, two Mehs, do all the other emojis have parents? Why didn't we see any of them? Do emojis retire once they get old and pass the tradition onto their children? Did Gene's father or mother run the Meh box until the day before Gene would start work? Why did Jailbreak complain about wanting to be herself and be free of rules and restrictions when she was already making a living hacking phone records and lived in a seedy underground app? Why did she say you can only be a princess or a bride in Textopolis when the current emoji library has dozens and dozens of female emojis doing various things other than being tied down by, uh, patriarchal themes or whatever? If leaving apps is so easy, why didn't we see any other characters visit other apps just out of curiosity? Why didn't a young teen boy ever use the eggplant emoji? How is it even a little realistic that a young teen boy would have downloaded Dropbox or a pirating app? Even with all these questions left unanswered, you still get plenty of content that will make you want to tear your hair out. Hi-Five is the most deeply irritating character I have ever seen in my life and he eats a piece of candy after barfing it up. Gene just shuts down and is willing to let emojis die just because Jailbreak didn't become his girlfriend, but he suddenly becomes the hero at the end of the story and Jailbreak goes running back to him anyway, having suddenly returned his feelings because he complained about it, I guess? The robots dab while dancing. Jailbreak keeps speaking in internet shorthand. Sir Patrick Stewart voices the role of a pile of poop and has a maximum of five lines in the entire film. The teen boy gets a girlfriend because the emoji he sends her is "super cool". There's no possible way to redeem this tripe. I wish I could give it zero stars, because it doesn't deserve anything. I was even able to give one teeny, tiny nod to Sausage Party just because it might encourage future adult-oriented CGI films that might actually be watchable. But this? This deserves nothing. I hope the creators of this feel bad and I hope T.J. Miller is mocked and ridiculed for the rest of his life. I hope Sony Animation goes under and I never have to think about this thing ever again.

reviews.review_title: The Emoji Movie was a Comedic Fail.
reviews.content: The Emoji movie is about Gene, an emoji that just can't stick to who he is meant to be, trying to figure out who he is. I chose to review this movie because it had a lot of hype behind it before it came out and once it did it, didn't really go anywhere. Also, this movie had a relatively low budget and hasn't made that back yet.The movie takes place in a cell phone and is focused around a series of emojis. The movie starts with Gene, who is questioning who is he meant to be, messing up and making the wrong face when the owner of the cell phone, Alex, tries to send him. So, Alex thinks that his phone is broken and makes an appointment to get his phone reset. The emojis find out about this and the emoji in charge sends some robots to find him and make him be the emoji he is meant to be. As Gene is running from these robots, he teams up with Jailbreak, a princess emoji turned feminazi that is meant to be Gene's love interest but refuses to be a love interest, and Hi-5, the stereotypical annoying fat friend that ends up holding everyone band and causing way more problems. As they run away from these robots they go through many different apps and we learn more about each character as they learn more about themselves.My Evaluation: o Presented on a scale of 1-3 o 1 being the worst o 3 being the best o Some half points may be awardedThe Content/Plot o The plot was nothing new. The troubled teen doesn't know what he is supposed to be, enter daring adventuress. They run away from the villain, get into shenanigans, become good friends, defeat THE villain, find who they are meant to be. o Nothing new. We have all seen a hundred movies like that. So, plot was mediocre in my opinion. o Content/Plot earns a 2/3. Casting o The three main characters were voiced by well-known comedians and the voicing was OK. I mean, the voice actors really tried their best to help this movie. o Casting earns a 2.5/3. AV Quality o The Audio/Video Quality is the best thing about this movie. o The Audio almost always lines up perfectly to the animation. The video is animated in 120 Frames per second and 4KHD. This movie looks amazing. The animation team did a really great job on this movie, especially for having such a low budget. o AV Quality earns a 3/3. Audience Appeal o I watched this movie with my parents and 2 children and throughout the entire movie the kids were bored and wanted to get up and play and the parents were not entertained. o This movie has quite a few jokes but they aren't funny? Like they sound like a librarian wrote them. o This movie fails in the audience appeal department. It is meant to be a funny family movie and it wasn't funny and families didn't really care for it. o Audience appeal earns 1/3. Characters o Main character analyzation  Gene  Boring. We have seen it before, nothing new.  HI-5  Again, the stereotypical fat best friend. Nothing new.  Jailbreak  A new type of character I have never seen before, but that doesn't mean it was good.  She was written to be a "strong independent woman" but she came off as a feminazi. o Overall, the characters are predictable and suck. o Characters earned 1/3. Product Placement o I wasn't planning on having this be criteria that I analyzed; however, since 10+ products or services were referenced in this movie I can't help it. o There was a scene where the main characters jumped into the *newly released* Just Dance App and basically promoted the app for 5+ minutes. o They also jump into Candy Crush, Spotify, Twitter, YouTube, etc. o So many product/services mentioned in this movie, almost unnecessarily. o Product placement earns a 1/3. Overall Score o 10.5/36 o Average score: 1.75/3.

The second the movie was over, I was dumbstruck, and I wasn't the only one. When the movie ended I thought there would be a big round of applause but when I turned around I saw that about half the audience was still in their seats. I looked at a couple of people, some were speechless and most were crying. Nonetheless I didn't hear a word. When I thought about it, i realized an applause would have been ridiculous. When someone asked me how the movie was I was going to say it was amazing, but that wouldn't have done the movie justice. The movie was an extremely moving, emotional experience. As a non-Christian who nevertheless respects the historical figure of Jesus Christ and the beauty of his philosophy and teachings, I found The Emoji Movie to be a powerful portrayal of much that I think is worthwhile about the Christ story. I know the film has been maligned for anti-semitic content (perhaps because Gene make mistakes in the film and are seen as the villain instead of the hero), and for various other problems - but let's face it - any movie portraying this subject was bound to face strong reactions. And kudos to Tony Leondis for not shying away from the subject by creating a sterile, gutless, Disney story out of what really was a good example of the everyday horror of life on the fringes of the millennial empire. Leondis invents a new genre with The Emoji Movie - that of historical horror. The performances in this film are inspired. I felt that the film brought out the cowardice of the apostles very forcefully, and the courage of Gene life was palpable to the very end. I also felt that the voice acting from James Corden was one of a kind and compelling - almost making me believe that he was truly a Hi-5 in real life! Final word - this is not a film for the whole family nor is it a feel-good film. Don't see it if you're not willing to confront the worst aspects of human nature up close. And don't go in looking for your own version of the story - it's not your film! This is what Tony Leondis believes, and it's his own revelation, not necessarily to be shared by all.

reviews.review_title: The Emoji Movie could've been a game a Candy Crush because of some insane plot holes.
reviews.content: When I say that the emoji movie never should've happened, I'm not saying that like "Sony never should've made this crap", I mean that the PLOT of the movie quite literally makes no sense, and almost all of the obstacles that were faced could've been easily avoided.So for those of you who have managed to read this far, The Emoji Movie follows the life and adventures of the "meh" emoji, Gene, who makes the wrong face when the phone's user, Alex, is trying to send a text to the girl he likes (Addie).The "emoji council" or whatever you want to call it, decides that it's best that Gene be deleted because he is a malfunction, and deletion robots are sent after him. Somewhere in Gene's escape from said robots he is united with Hi-5. This is where the plot nosedives into hell.I'm sure that nearly every person who sees this movie can agree that the characters are painfully unoriginal. Gene is your typical protagonist in a "I just wanna fit in" situation, Hi-5 is the dumb sidekick who doubles as the comic relief, and Jailbreak is so awful she deserves her own paragraph.So Hi-5 tells Gene that he can be fixed by Jailbreak, a hacker, but they've got to find her in the piracy app. They leave Textopolis (I know it's bad), find Jailbreak, and are then attacked by deletion robots but manage to escape to Candy Crush (ad).It's in the Candy Crush scene that you realize how "Mary Sue" Jailbreak really is. To everyone in the movie she is seen as flawless. She randomly says things like "Men are always taking credit for things girls do" and "I'm not some princess waiting for her prince". In the Just Dance scene she claims she can't dance so Gene encourages her, and less than two minutes later she's a fantastic dancer. She is a textbook Mary Sue with no likable qualities, and every single time she opened her mouth I had to hold back from audibly groaning.So now there comes the most crucial flaw with the movie: it should've never happened. I know this is a kids movie, and a child would probably never notice such a thing as I'm about to explain, but it's lazy writing and deserves to be called out.Below is a list of obstacles that the group faces throughout the story:Piracy App - To get Jailbreak. Eventually chased out by deletion robots. Escape to Candy Crush. Candy Crush - Just an ad for Candy Crush. Just Dance - Literally just an ad for Just Dance. Deletion robots soon show up and drag Hi-5 into the trash with them. Trash - Get Hi-5 Dropbox - Try and fix Gene. Also an ad.Another important thing to note here is that these apps that they travel through are all set up like rooms with hallways dividing them all. You do not have to go through multiple apps to get to Dropbox, you'd just have to walk down a hallway to get to Dropbox.So technically, the only apps that the three HAD to go to were the Piracy app to get Jailbreak, and the Candy Crush app because that's how they escaped to robots. So please tell me WHY ON EARTH they then proceeded to go through Just Dance AND the trash (which they never would've had to go through if they hadn't been in Just Dance). It's stupid. This movie should've been a game of Candy Crush and a leisurely stroll down a hallway, but instead Sony had to make things complicated.Along with this awfulness comes the horrific subplot involving the marital problems of Gene's parents, Mel and Mary (who are also both "meh" emojis). Imagine having to sit there for five to ten minutes at a time, listening to nothing but monotone voices. That's what this subplot is. A whole bunch of boring. I'm not even going to go into detail on that one because it's just too boring for me to talk about it.So now there are some tiny nit picky things that bothered me: - "Emojis are the most important form of communication" (actual quote) - The idea that words aren't cool anymore - A text conversation between Alex and Addie is shown early in the movie, and it consists of nothing but random emojis that make no real sense, just proves how lazy Sony is. - Poop jokes aren't funny and never will be. - A "phone store appointment" event added to the calendar on Alex's phone is what tips off the emojis that they're being deleted. How did they get "we're being deleted" from "phone store appointment"? - You don't need to go to the phone store to have your phone reset. - There is no such thing as a phone deletion machine. - The conflict (the phone being deleted) is resolved when Gene makes multiple faces and sends this magical face changing emoji to Addie. - Addie assumes that this one emoji that changes faces represents Alex emotionally and tells him that she's glad he's one of those guys that can "express his emotions". It's an emoji. - Addie and her friend are casually chilling in the phone store while Alex is deleting his phone. Why? - Why is Addie not weirded out when she receives nothing but one emoji out of the blue from some guy ten feet away from her? - She clearly see's the phone is being deleted, why doesn't that make her question whether or not he actually sent it? - The whole movie ends with a cliché dance party.All in all, please do not see this movie. It's bad enough that it went up from a 0% on rotten tomatoes, and I really don't want to see an Emoji Movie 2 in the future.

I'm sorry for anyone who thinks that 2 is an unfair rating because it's only a kids movie, but that's not a good enough excuse. Saying that is completely unfair, as there have been loads of movies for kids that have been well done with funny jokes for kids and adults, with a unique art style and a heartwarming plot. Kids movies that didn't seem like it wasn't checked enough, and movies that had actual effort put into it. The emoji movie does not have any effort put into it, and even someone who is very young can tell that most of the jokes in the emoji movie are lazy and stupid, and the plot is laughable, not to mention it's basically an advert you have to pay for. It's just a movie to attract kids and get a lot of money. You might enjoy the emoji movie, but I would NOT recommend it. The emoji movie makes me sick.

reviews.review_title: Was this movie a horcrux? Because it took a part of my soul when I left
reviews.content: Where do we begin.Let's start with the whole concept of this movie. This is a prime example of the older generation trying too hard to appeal to us 'millennials' by including emojis. Instead, I feel more insulted more than anything, as the movie depicts us as zombies glued to our phones, as shown in the intro scene. They also canceled a Popeye movie for this garbage, which is truly disgraceful. Moving on to the content of this movie, let me start with saying it includes a plethora of unfunny poop jokes and puns that you can see coming a light-year away. If the writers believe their targeted audience would find their jokes humorous, then the writers are incompetent, immature five-year-olds. The plot is as barren as the surface of Pluto. There are no relevant plot twists and you can predict the exactly how everything is going to end, so I'm not sure if anyone can have the movie spoiled for them. The character are all empty clichés. A hero with no personality. Check. A comic relief. Check. A love interest for the hero. Check. A generic villain. Check. Every other character in an irrelevant one-liner. What were the themes of this movie? That's a tough one. All I could think of is... express your emotions? Which frankly is bullsh*t.tl;dr: Only watch this movie ironically. If you want decent things to watch, avoid this movie like a pile of feces contaminated with Ebola.
Nothing but a device to suck up all the new generation's money.

The message of the film is the following: If you like a girl, don't talk to her, because you are going to mess something up (beacause you're dumb, and a disgrace), just send her an emoji, and she'll like you. That mentality of the social media generation has always made me sad, but the fact that a Hollywood movie sending this as an essence towards young children makes me very-very angry. No, if you like a girl, go ahead, get your balls together, and talk to her, face to face! Don't just dream, send her strange little pictures on messenger, and stare her from a long distance like a weirdo! Nah! What kind of person can tell the absolutely worst thing to the children?! I think every person who was involved should be ashamed of themselves!

Gene is the generic "guy who is different than the rest who is accepted in the end", Hi-5 (who's idea of a name is this?), "the comedy relief who is annoying and as hyperactive as a 3 year on sugar", and Jailbreak, the "hardened chick who is kinda of a feminist that would fit in well with the Tumblr crowd of edgy 20 somethings" Also, there are other characters who are completely one dimensional and only used for "teh plot" and/or comedy. Finally, this movie sucked big time. The only positive thing is that most people hate it, including children. That restored some of my faith in humanity. Anyways, this is Princess Radar signing out.
