May be spoilers for this "movie" ahead. Where do I begin, with the festering pile of sh*t, that is "The Emoji Movie"? Well originally I went to see this thing (it does not deserve the title of "movie") with my friends as a sort of joke, as we already knew it was going to be garbage, but we did not expect it to be quite as bland and mind-numbing awful as it was. When we first walked into the room, we stuck out like a sore thumb amongst a sea of 7 year old's with fidget spinners in their hands. We knew already that we had made a mistake. When the movie began I already felt my faith in humanity slowly ebb out of my body. At the beginning we are introduced to our main emoji "Gene" he is a "meh" emoji and is about as interesting as a sack of flour, he proclaims many times, to keep the attention span of the brain dead children, that it is his first day on the phone he repeats this to practically all he meets in some failing effort to make the audience care. When he finally makes his way to the main building, after explaining what every pathetic little emoji's job is, he proceeds to laugh at a meaningless and unfunny sight gag that in turn shows us what makes "Gene" special, he can express different emotions, his parents happen to see this and pull him aside into the bathroom and explain to him that making the wrong face is bad, or something, which then makes "Gene" upset and he comes out with some spiel about being unique and "different". The only reason they are in the bathroom is so we can hear Patrick Stuart's character, "Poo", make a joke about how he is a walking pile of sh*t. Gene storms off (I've used the quotation marks enough) to start his first day on the phone. In this scene we are introduced to the villain and Gene's friend simultaneously "Smiler" and "Hi-5" (haha loll because it like text language) who is a walking hand, about as interesting as you can imagine. So Gene is picked by their user Alex to be sent to his girlfriend Addie McAllister ( Who came up with that name "Addie" like the h*ll?) Long story short, Gene messes up and is told that he must be deleted or sent off the phone, or some stupid cr*p like that, by the Villain Smiler. He runs into James Corden's terrible character Hi-5 again (keep in mind these two have only met twice for the first time in the space of ten minutes) who helps him escape Smiler's evil army of anti-virus bots. The most awful scene in this movie has arrived "The loser lounge" where the writers out of thousands of internet jokes to choose from, and they chose the throw away "bye Felicia" joke. Hi-5 and the yellow one talk about their stupid little reasons as to why they need to leave textropolis, so they try and enlist the help of a hacker called "jailbreak" (loll like wat u do to your phone, this movie hurts me) by going through a stupid piracy app and she agrees (who knew?) After this there's a load of awful product placement that I'll skip over where they mention going to the cloud,for yet again for some awful reason, along the way James Corden's character is kidnapped (thank God) and they go and rescue him. Because friendship is beautiful. Alex is getting progressively more annoyed with his phone after it turns on twice during class (oh no how awful) so he decides to go and get it completely wiped. So the villain, Smiler, thinks capturing and killing the yellow one is a way to solve this problem, so she sends out a bigger version of one of the awfully designed anti-virus bots. Which is sure to do the job. It doesn't. They escape again and finally get to the fabled Dropbox where the cloud is held. So they can do something about making themselves better (great lesson to teach kids "if you aren't perfect the way you are, completely change everything about yourself!") They get there, jailbreak and the yellow one realise that they love each other, she rejects him and it breaks his heart, and he finally became the meh he always wanted to be. He gets back to emoji land and Smiler still wants to kill him (I wanted to squash him like a bug long ago), and the dad trust to stop her, then the mum but they both fail, (wow, who knew?) Smiler is defeated. But Alex has already brought his phone to be wiped, so they need to find the perfect emoji to send to Alex's girlfriend before he wipes the phone, like that is gonna change jack sh*t, and guess who they send? Gene because he has all the emotions, or something, it works, AddieMcKillme comes out with this laughable line, "You're one of those guys who can express his emotions, I like that", which is ironic considering half of the movie is about convincing you that emoji's are much better than stupid 'ol, uncool words. Alexa decides to stop the phone from being wiped, and super, happy, fun, mega dance-party proceeds. The end. Don't ever go to see this money grabbing, "kids" movie, as it is guaranteed to leave you soulless and wishing for death, hope you enjoyed my review!

Watched this with my 8 year old daughter and really enjoyed it. Was shocked to see that it had a 3.3 rating. Gave it a 10 in order to offset that horrible rating because it deserves better.
The movie concept was unique and had an interesting perspective. Just like Toy Story brought our toys to life, this movie brings your apps/emojis to life, and I thought the concept was executed really well. There were also some good lines in the script.
Deserves 10 stars!

(Warning: Contains Minor Spoilers) One does not watch a film like The Emoji Movie expecting anything but corporate pandering from a company as vile as Sony. However the film somehow managed to be worst than my expectations. Considering I have seen both The Nut Job and Minions in theaters, saying The Emoji Movie is the worst animated film I have ever seen, and one of the worst films I have ever seen, shows that the true quality of this film. What's the plot? Gene the emoji wants to become "meh," as he is a malfunction. After destroying the emoji center, Smiler, who is simply annoying, wants to kill Gene. Gene finds a useless comic relief named Hi-Five, who leads him Jailbreak, a hacker emoji that has extremely forced character traits. You can assume that along the way there will be poop jokes, jokes that are so bad you don't even know they're jokes, bad outdated references, a void of likable characters and emotion (ironic for a film centered around emojis), forced feminism, a romance between meh and female meh that is focused on for around 20 minutes,and scenes, like the one centered in Just Dance, that are so blatantly awful and go on for so long, you will want to bludgeon yourself multiple times. Whenever you think the film can't get worse it does, and by the third act, my friends and I laughed so hard, since the ending was so nonsensical, pandering, and followed every cliché you've seen in other awful kids movies, like the ending dance sequence, except they are executed worse. One may say there are worse films than The Emoji Movie, and there probably are. And by that I mean there may be a few films worse than it. But the mentality behind this film, created from a greedy company that wants to create low-effort garbage to exploit a young audience while having the audacity to also make fun of that audience, as lazily as one could. This company pushes back reviews to allow films like this to do well, and says that the film isn't bad because it is made for a certain age group. This company has no purpose, other than to leech off of your money, and to continue releasing mass quantities of terrible films, like The Star, and potentially Peter Rabbit. The day Sony goes bankrupt will be happy day for all of humanity. Let's hope that day is sooner rather than later.

Colourful, bright with lovely animation. The story is decent, fairly cliché kids movie, younger kids will probably love it, less so for older kids. The product placement is very, very heavy handed and conspicuous and it's meme attempts are laughably bad. Kids are unlikely to notice, but there's some 'so bad it's good' novelty for the older viewers. Overall it has okay character and message, that even adults can quite enjoy and get somewhat immersed in. It's overall, very OK. I would rate 5 star if it wasn't so ridiculously full of product placement and their 'strong female character' is quite forced. (Seriously, strong women don't need to constantly reassert how strong and independent they are...) The message of this movie? USE DROPBOX PLAY CANDY CRUSH AND DDR AND DID YOU KNOW DROPBOX IS SECURE? Oh, and be yourself and accept everyone for who they are. Gene, the main character is a 'meh emoji, and that reflects the movie. It's just meh.

Remember all of the animated classics. Brilliances and captivating viewing experiences that have entertained us and will continue fascinate generations who will continue to watch these classics long after I and indeed you have left this plane of existence where there will be sequels to all of the following, ever-continuing sequels which never get stale. Classics like, Your Iron Giants, Your Cowboy Bebops, Your One Hundred and One Dalmatians, Your Fists of the North Star, Your Fantasias, Your Grave of the Fireflies, Your Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs, And your Neon Genesis Evangelions,Welp, Tear 'em all down, Animation is dead.I was hoping to have off myself before the release of the meme movie but thankfully for all of humanity and those who care about me, it has since, fortunately been canceled after the relentless mocking of this piece of infringement of our human rights. Its worst sin, in my eyes at least is that the Popeye movie which I was pretty excited for, the first time I saw it I was overcome with nostalgic memories from when i would watch old 1950s Popeye cartoons, and now, the Popeye movie won't exist, we traded it for the Emoji Movie.

reviews.review_title: This movie sucks - like, a lot...
reviews.content:
Contrary to many unbelievable online reviews, this movie is quite trash. If, in the future, the human race were to look back at our past achievements and judge whether or not we were on the right track, they'd most likely assume we were in the dark ages again, only this time with emojis.
This movie has no merit, no redeeming qualities and no enjoyment to be had while watching it. This 90 minute endurance test serves only as product placement and an advertisement. If you went to the theatre to watch this movie, you'd probably have a hard time telling the difference between the pre-movie ads and the movie itself. That would also mean that you paid for that experience, and for that you have my sympathy. 
They actually somehow got Sir Patrick Stewart to voice a role in this movie, and his character was, quite literally, poop. Delivering some of the laziest poop jokes that Hollywood has ever written, I guess even Picard needs the money. This movie is absolute trash, not even worthy of being taken into a tip or a landfill, just atomically disassemble the entire thing and launch it into space where some alien colony will find it and eradicate it with lasers. 
The Emoji Movie made 217.8 Million dollars at the box office with a budget of 50 million dollars. Economists suspect that this movie will serve as a catalyst for another worldwide economic crash, and I for one welcome it.
This movie actually won awards and were nominated for some others, some of which were more deserving. It won worst picture, worst director, worst screen combo and worst screenplay. It was also nominated for the Black Reel Awards, Movieguide Awards and Kids' Choice Awards, for whatever value that's worth. 
I don't think I can actually get away with simply saying that this movie is bad, everyone knows it. You know it, I know it, the people that made this movie know it and even the people that were paid to give these movies good reviews especially know it. Things need to change. We need to riot. We need to start a new Hollywood revolution. Anyone that is listening needs to heed my call. We need to tell people that we will not stand for this anymore. WE. WANT. FREEDOM.

reviews.review_title: A Singularity of Shameless Corporate Crap
reviews.content: Never has a movie made me as unreasonably angry as this movie has. Even before I watched, I could feel a pit of loathing form in the depths of my psyche. Probably because the movie's assertion that "emojis are the most important form of communication" offends me on a spiritual level. Or perhaps the very existence of this film reminds me just how banal, insipid, and base Hollywood's process of filmmaking has become. Rather than attempt to break new ground by trying something new with a new IP, Corporate executives, in their never-ending obsession to never take any risk, have birthed this cosmic terror upon the universe. This movie is the Foodfight of a new generation. There is no artistic merit to this movie, no philosophical message to convey besides the usual schlock one inserts into a children's movie such BE YOURSELF, YOU'RE SPECIAL, and all that drivel which might hit home in any other movie. This movie only exists to be a 1-hour and 31-minute advertisement. This film wastes substantial time with parts that suffer cancerous inclusion of real world apps, such as Spotify, Instagram, Just Dance, and Dropbox. If you might be thinking that The Emoji Movie is something that your children might want to see, shove those thoughts away now, because waterboarding is a more substantial past-time to inflict upon them. Your kids deserve so much better than this, an over glorified ad that is a microcosm of everything wrong with modern Hollywood.

reviews.review_title: Interesting way to introduce gender dysphoria
reviews.content: Would have been a 7 if the ending was better. If they just let everyone die at the end it would have at least been a 5.

I was dreading my kid wanting to watch this because I had heard how bad it was. I heard that it was so awful, the worst kids movie ever, unbearable, etc. I managed to let my son forget about it while it was theaters and felt like I had dogged a bullet. When it came out on Netflix, I begrudgingly let him watch it. It's not that bad! Really, it's not. Would I recommend it to my friends and their kids? Not in particular. Is it insightful and clever? No. But is it a terribly bad movie? Also no. Kids (about age 8 and under probably) will be entertained and adults may be mildly amused at a few of the jokes. Anna Farris was really cute as the Jailbreak character and High-Five, while slightly obnoxious at times, was actually pretty funny. The plot has a few logistical problems, but most all movies do. And it's a kids movie; they don't really care about that stuff. Their standards aren't that high. 
So overall, it's FINE. Doesn't deserve all the hate.

I didn't believe that this movie was going to be as bad as other reviews said it was. I was wrong. After watching this movie I had to take a break from life. I returned home and laid down on the couch and just stared at the ceiling. I couldn't do anything and to be honest I didn't want to. I started questioning the reality of this world and the future of animation. It's safe to say that I became a hollow shell of my former self after seeing this movie. Jitterbug echos in my head every time I close my eyes now thanks to this corporate garbage.

reviews.review_title: Not the worst thing ever... Just.. meh.
reviews.content: When the trailer came out, I too fell victim to the hate train hype this movie was building. Is the movie good? No. Is it the worst thing ever? Probably not. I understand the hate this is getting, seeing how absurd the subject matter is. In execution it is less bad than it is just generic and forgettable. Many people thought this would be a so bad it's good flick. It's not bad enough to pull that off. It's also not bad enough to be insulting and painful to watch. It really is just a generic kid's film. In my experience, the movie went by pretty quickly, and I never really felt too bored or offended. Once the hate hype dies down, no one will remember this film.
Watched this for the meme and it was so much worse than anticipated. It was a slog to get through, everything was dreadful apart from the colours and Sir Patrick Stewart.

reviews.review_title: I wish I could rate this movie a 0 out of 10.
reviews.content: Let me tell anyone who reads this why this movie is the worst:(even though I haven't seen it but I've heard about it.)The Name of This Movie: Unoriginal, uninspired, and can already tell the viewer(s) that it is a futile attempt at pandering to this generation Animation: The only about this movie than isn't bland and/or awful is the animation. Just because it looks okay doesn't make it any better. Plot: The plot of this movie has been done to death and is similar to beating a dead horse. (The plot is that everyone is normal except for one guy who is different and that makes him "weird", so he possibly goes on a journey to become normal and at the end, he realizes that being different is what makes him special.) There are so many other movies that do this plot and handle it much better than this "movie" does. (for example, Wreck It Ralph)Product Placements: There are so many product placements (for example, Candy Crush, Facebook, Twitter, Just Dance, Dropbox, Spotify, etc.) that it's intrusive and a cheap series of attempts at capitalizing on the audience that uses these apps. In other words, the ludicrous amount of product placements makes this film The Advertisement Movie. (as I like to call it.)The Characters: The characters (as far as I know) are bland and don't really get any character development at all. The hacker emoji character is a rip-off of the character Wyldstyle from The Lego Movie, which is much better than this waste of money.Conclusion: Do not watch this film, you would be better off spending your money on any other movie that is not this one. Do not watch this movie, all it will do at most is that it might keep the children awake but even the children will probably get bored and ask to leave the theater and go back home. In other words, anyone who reads this review (and even those who don't read it) would be better off watching paint dry for about 90 minutes and giving their $10 (or so) to charity.Final Review Score: 0 out of 10 (if it was possible to give it a 0 on this site.)

reviews.review_title: The movie wasn't terrible, but it wasn't good.
reviews.content:
The movie was not terrible, but it was not that great. The plot wasn't great, The jokes near the beginning were weak, some things didn't make sense.
There was one stupid scene where Hive Five, Gene, and Jailbreak were going through the Just Dance App. I didn't even know there was one. It was also one of the most cringy things I have ever seen.
Also, another reason why the movie wasn't great, was that the movie brought up Internet Trolls. The movie tells us that they are green monsters inside the piracy app, but they are actually real human beings.
Overall, the movie was not terrible, but I do not recommend it.

reviews.review_title: Does product placement automatically means the movie is gonna be bad?
reviews.content: This time a lot of people got it very and awfully wrong with this movie. Having seen that this movie was going to be about product placement they instantaneously hated the movie before it even came out. Then why should they watch the movie and be open for what the director was trying to do? Why should they see what the movie was about, what was it trying to transmit as a message or if it had a good-enough story or well designed animation or good musical score?Since their minds were already made they decided to hate the movie anyway even if the movie was somewhat good... as is the case in which I though it was. This was a very fun and entertaining movie that without the product placement in it (for which I didn't give one cr*p about) it's actually a fun movie with a great message for both kids and adults.I tried to watch this movie with the most opened mind I could and I though the movie's message about self-discovering, the animation, the humor, the voice acting and the musical score along with the story were actually very good and in no way deserving the rating it got here or from the critics.I would even go so far to say that it was better than Inside Out. At least this movie sanded a clear message while that pixar flick was all over the place when it came to transmitting a clear message to the audience.In conclusion go watch this movie and read as few things about it as possible because behind these bad reviews is probably an agenda going on against movies with product placement. If you can forget the product placement for an hour and a half you'll enjoy this movie!

reviews.review_title: Talking about the movie here. So here's my opinion on it:
reviews.content: The Emoji Movie is poorly written and the jokes are unfunny. This doesn't deserve to be a masterpiece out of almost every single animated movie. I don't really recommend watching this pile of trash because of how stupid, how unfunny, how boring, and how unenjoyable it is. Plot kinda lacks about why this movie is about emojis, and somehow the movie plagarized ideas from other movies I liked, such as The LEGO Movie, Wreck it Ralph, and Inside Out. Basically I'll explain more here. So basically about Gene and his friends setting his journey to go on an app adventures? That literally doesn't pretty mean about why this movie is about emojis. In the other hand, Jailbreak, the tritagonist of the movie, is nothing but a ripoff of Wyldstyle from The LEGO Movie. reviews.review_title: The worst movie I've ever seen
reviews.content: This movie perfectly represents the worst aspects of Hollywood's corporate greed. Sony pictures pumped out yet another offensive, low-budget pile of crap that is about as investing as watching paint dry. This is a bit-by-bit review of The Emoji Movie.The plot is lazy and very cliché. In the movie, Gene, who is a "meh" emoji, wants to go to work in the smartphone as a meh emoji. He must make this expression to beam a "meh" emoji up to the phone. However, (oh no!) he makes the wrong face. Wow, exciting. Smiler, the ruler of the emojis, wants to kill Gene because he sucks at his job. However, Gene thinks that everyone hates him because he is unique and goes on an adventure to make him a "meh." He meets Hi-5, who is the "comic relief." The reason that I put quotes around "comic relief" is because he is not actually funny. He is just the kid-pandering random goofball that adds nothing to the story. In order to complete his quest, Gene hires a hacker, Jailbreak, who is the blatant feminist character. I even remember a specific line of dialogue from her: "Women are always inventing things that men are taking credit for." Subtle there, Sony. From there they wander into the Just Dance app and play Just Dance for an atrociously long scene which is a blatant product placement. Repeat that last sentence, but replace "Just Dance" with "Candy Crush" and you have the next 5 minutes of the movie. From there they get to their final destination, Dropbox (another product placement), and there Gene says that he loves Jailbreak. She turns him down because she doesn't want to be defined by the man she marries. I am dead serious. I would tell you about the ending to the movie, but by then I was so bored and saddened by this movie that I fell asleep. Sorry, but I hope that this much has convinced you to keep your $10 and do something better with it, like flush it down the toilet. Offensive, horribly written, terribly voice-acted, and blatant feminist messages, The Emoji Movie is the worst movie I have ever seen.BURN IT WITH FIRE BURN IT WITH FIRE BURN IT WITH FIRE

Snubbed from the oscars. Brilliant storytelling, excellent characters, prestigious acting. Was disappointed. Didn't have enough poop jokes. The poop jokes were always funny and never out of place. Personally believe this deserved a trilogy.

I found that this movie worked surprisingly well as a form of discipline. Prior to July 28th, 2017, when my children did something bad, I would punish them by taking away their devices or dessert (you know, the norm). Unfortunately, this method never deemed sufficient, as they would still repeat their actions. However, when my youngest, Timmy, called my oldest, Todd, a "stinky pile of bologna", I knew what I had to do. I marched little Timmy to the car, drove to the nearest cinema, and purchased two tickets to The Emoji Movie. Rest assured, he will never call Todd anything ever again. Or sleep at night. But you know, you have to take the bad with the good.

reviews.review_title: Watching this movie feels like pain in the heart
reviews.content: Let's start with the opening of this mega pile of trash. The opening feels like it's completely fine with people getting attached to smartphones, in fact, this feels like it's encouraging them to do it. This is a kids movie but it keeps filling their head with the bad stuffs. We are shown teenagers use their phone 24 hours a day, even at class, and that's something kids should not do. And it's only the B-plot of this movie. The main plot doesn't deliver bad messages to kids, but it makes us feel really bad. The plot is so unoriginal, in fact it made me feel like it's a phone version of Wreck-It-Ralph. While Wreck-It-Ralph is based on video games, this movie is based on THE LITTLE FACES THAT WE USE WHILE TEXTING! Did they run out of ideas? Who thought this would be a good idea for a movie? The plot is so boring too. The jokes are so unfunny and cringy it made me facepalm so many times. Candy Crush in 2017? PPAP on YouTube in 2017?In conclusion, don't watch this movie.

reviews.review_title: Literally the worst movie I have ever seen in my entire life

There is not one second of consideration put into any frame of this film. Every character is bland, every design is generic, every joke and plot thread is predictable.It's a desperate and I do mean desperate attempt to capitalize on a growing and recent trend. It's a money-grabber to say the least. You take a subject popular with young kids, you get paid by a bunch of different companies to display their terrible apps in the movie, etc, etc. This movie had no passion. Movies are made to make money but they are typically a labour of love. Most directors put their heart and souls into their films, while clearly no one cared about this one.I feel bad for Patrick Stewart. Please do not give one cent to the makers of this movie.
This movie is proof that we are doomed as a species.

reviews.review_title: Better than Inside Out, Wreck-it Ralph, & The Lego Movie combined
reviews.content: This is a fun movie, full of self-aware comedy, cleverly playing with the relevant themes of modern smartphone apps, social media, & the digitally connected youth culture. It's a movie that completely commits to its smartphone theme, with all its dialogue, visuals, and humor smartphone related. I found myself chuckling with amusement throughout.For many reasons, I actually liked this better than similarly-themed animated movies like Inside Out, Wreck-it Ralph, & The Lego Movie. For instance, it's less pretentious than Inside Out, and it doesn't suffer from the excessively frantic short- attention-span pacing of Wreck-it Ralph or The Lego Movie.Visually, The Emoji Movie even has a few instances of artistic brilliance, such as its beautifully imaginative renderings of Instagram, Spotify, & The Cloud.As for the haters (critics) flooding this movie with low scores, realize that their hatred is largely not truly directed at this movie itself, but at the culture it represents. Really they're only using this movie as a springboard excuse for scoffing at the modern youth culture of digital communication, social media, smartphones, etc. It's the grumpy old man syndrome of mocking any aspect of culture that's new, popular, and likely unfamiliar on a personal level, because they may not have grown up with it. It's why nostalgic themes such as classic video games (Wreck-it Ralph) or classic toys (The Lego Movie) get showered with higher ratings, despite being similarly themed, no more clever, and no less silly than The Emoji Movie.

reviews.review_title: What's with all the bad reviews??
reviews.content:
We enjoyed watching this with the kids. My kids do love this movie and just keep watching it again and again. I'm shocked to learn it has so many awful reviews.
I cannot tell how good or bad the director of the movie is. But as a regular viewer who has small kids I can say it is quite entertaining and has some good things for little kids to learn, e.g. the main character, Gene, never leaves his friends behind and treats other members of his little emoji world with kindness no matter where they are in their social hierarchy. There are some interesting parallels with the real world as well: Gene has to be "meh" just like his parents who are "real pros". But instead he has a special ability to express many feelings at once which is treated as a "malfunction". One real story I can recall was about a kid who was incredibly talented dancer but could not focus in class and was nearly diagnosed with ADHD. We force kids and people in general into some sort of boxes and if they don't fit we consider it a disorder, a "malfunction", something that is not cool and should be fixed. This animation movie teaches little kids to be themselves and freely express themselves. Old idea but good nonetheless. This is great.
Whoever left extremely low ratings are probably sad people who cannot see anything good in life. Maybe the storyline wasn't great and the director wasn't good but there are good things about this anination and you cannot seriously be that displeased with just about everything.

reviews.review_title: Truly the best movie in the 10's.
reviews.content: Opened my eyes to the problems of the world. The plot and the character development was so unique, thinking about it gives me the chills.The character of Meh deeply describes how some people are restricted by their genetic makeup while the High Face character really shows how we live in a society. :( When Jailbreak revealed her true identity I had to recoil from the shock because there truly never was a bigger plot twist than that.When we watched this movie in the cinema, it got a 23 minute standing ovation as the credits played. Gosh, thinking about that moment when everyone stood up and clapped brings me to tears.This is truly a work of art, a cinematic masterpiece. Forget about The Godfather or The Shining or any other movie that fails to live up to The Emoji Movie when in comparison.I recommend this film, giving it a 10 out of 10 because no other movie can place products as obvious as The Emoji Movie.

reviews.review_title: This might come at a surprise but.... I enjoyed it!
reviews.content: -Warning!-This movie review contains spoilers! Please do not read this review if you have not seen the movie!Now before anyone who hates this movie jumps on my back, I just want to say that I can understand the hate. When the trailer came out I thought the movie was not going to be that good! I looked into the movie a little bit more and I thought "Maybe it might not be that bad after all!" When I saw the movie, I thought "That was good!" This is my opinion on the movie, I can say what I like! Also, I'm not one of those people who gave this movie a sarcastic review. I'm being serious! Without further a do, lets get into the review!"The Emoji Movie" is about this emoji called Gene who has more than just one emoji. He can do multiple emotions when all other emoji's have just one. He wants to get fixed so he teams up with Hi-5 since he wants to get back in the cube too and a hacker named Jailbreak.There were some parts that I actually found enjoyable to watch! Examples of these scenes are Just Dance, The Candy Crush scene and many more! What I liked about the Just Dance scene is that they used good music and the dance movies were again enjoyable. The JD sequence was great in my opinion! I'm also a JD user myself so I really enjoyed that sequence! There was also a dance sequence at the end which I also enjoyed watching! I also really liked the animation and the characters! I thought they were fantastic! :DThere were, however some parts that I would like to see some improvements on. An example of this is the jokes. The poop jokes I did not laugh at because that is not my type of humor but there were other jokes (that were not poop jokes of course) that I quite laughed at. The plot line is quite predictable too. However I did not really mind if it was predictable or not.Overall, this movie was good! Some parts I would have loved to have seen being improved but I enjoyed it! You can go ahead and disagree with me but this is my opinion. For this movie, I'm giving it...8/10
Best. mocie. ever. period. no cap. the goat of movies.

I don't know what the budget was but it was it visually stunning. I nutted at those graphics. Then the plot twist at the end Jesus Christ. Out of all I would give this movie a 100000000000/10. This is what a quality film and the movies like Dunkirk should learn from this theatrical masterpiece

reviews.review_title: The Most Well Made, Underrated Visual Experience of All Time
reviews.content: I've been searching around for the movie greats on this website, and searched for some of the classics, like the Godfather, the Shawshank Redemption, Shindler's List, and Freddy Got Fingered, and I came across this beautiful, visually stunning masterpiece, assuming it will at least get an 8.3/10, and I was appalled to see such a low score on such a masterpiece. These primitive neanderthals think they have a sense of art? The morals and themes fly straight through there heads, while they are scratching their a**es for an hour and thirty minutes. Marlon Brando would be rolling in his grave, to see such an artistic beauty, rated a 2.8/10! I thought of Al Pacino, who did many classics, like Jack and Jill, when I saw TJ Miller's performance of Gene. Screw It! I thought of Gene Wilder! Just while I thought I was restoring my faith in humanity.Cheers, Bob Marley Writer, Actor, Director, Producer

Kids might not appreciate poop punching a fan but they would love the colors and shapes and funny gimmicks. the parents who brought the kids to the theater would get big laughs. It doesn't matter how much critics pan this movie numbers speak for themselves: it opened in over 4000 theaters. They don't do that unless the movie has wide market appeal. reviews.review_title: A masterpiece of film with beautiful animation and a stellar voice cast
reviews.content: To start this film was a true masterpiece of filmmaking with beautiful visuals and an inspired, original and truly gripping story. This must be one of the best made films since the invention of motion pictures, seriously, Hitchcock, Nolan and Spielberg are put to shame by this cinematic experience which clearly takes influence from French New- Wave cinema and the work of German Director Uwe Boll. Along with the spell-binding cinematography the picture is companied with side splitting humour, an example of this is between Gene and a Coffee cup emoji. The scene goes down as follows: Gene walks by and says 'Hello tea.' The coffee then replies, 'I'm not tea, I'm coffee.' That's it! Probably the best joke shown in cinemas in the past decade. This humour is as amazing as it is thanks to the stellar voice cast led by (Deadpool star) T.J. Miller, (Alvin and the Chipmunks Actress) Anna Farris and (Talk show host) James Cordon with a brilliant supporting cast including Sir Patrick Stewart (Masterfully cast as Poop), Maya Rudolph (Smiler) & Jake T. Austin (The highly relatable teen: Alex). Also, special commendation must go to Jennifer Coolidge and Steven Wright as Mary and Mel Meh (Respectively) who hilariously manage to keep up their monotone 'meh' voices for the whole film. The story itself has previously been compared to Wreck it Ralph and The Lego Movie however these reviewers are obviously just petty little man babies who can't notice art when they see it. The film's only issue regards the lack of payoff after the huge build-up of sexual tension between Gene and Jailbreak this is made up for, however, through Jailbreak's reasoning for (SPOILER) not reciprocating Gene's love. This shows a great move forward in the acceptance that women are not damsels in distress and love objects for white (or yellow in this case) men. The film is blessed with the enthused soundtrack of the greatest pop songs around and the relatability to its audience by using the current top trending YouTube videos: PPAP and I Like Trains. Finally, although primarily a comedy the film has two scenes that brought a genuine tear to my eye. I won't spoil the scenes but they involve Gene's parent meeting in Paris and something/someone getting deleted. In conclusion, this chef-d'oeuvre of cinema manages to simultaneously be a brilliant comedy, a heart-breaking love story & a time capsule representing everything 2016/17 stands for.💯/10

I absolutely love this movie I watch it on Netflix every day before I go to bed to have sweet dreams about all the characters. I've made so much fan-art for this movie, and the sick dance moves I got from the just dance scene. When me and my fam go clubbing, we got our sick Emoji Pop dance moves to flex on other people in da club. This movie has made my life so much better, I'll always have a crush on Gene The Emoji. Thank you Sony I love you <3 ;)))))

This movie was an emojinal rollercoaster. The pathos derived from its intense moments was indescribibile. What were these moments, exactly? Well, while watching the movie I noticed my retractable dildo had fallen off the shelf and knocked a lamp off, starting a fire in the house. I began getting hot in my seat, thinking this was some emotional work from the movie. Alas, I reluctantly unglued my eyes from the screen, and looked behind me, and everything was fine. Apparently my doctor told me later I was off my medications, as well as abusing an unprescribed dose of LSD. Now that I'm better and on my medications, I can wholeheartedly say that this movie was a masterpiece.

The Emoji movie has to be the best film since Nativity 3. It showed how anything and everything can be loved. At some points I could feel the tears rolling down my cheeks. When I came out of the cinema I wish I could see it a billion more times, so that's what I did. Go see it with your family and friends. Best film.

This film is terribly underrated. I'd say it goes to par with art films such as The Genius of Synedoche. The movie has many layers and causes many emotions. Happiness, sadness, nerve, the whole nine yards. Gene is deeply emotional, and that plays a big role in The Emoji Movie. The embarrassment Alex feels in the real world shows Gene's true inner torment. There's also an underlying theme of the DABDA scale, where Gene seems to be going through all 5 stages. It's hard to put everything into words, because this movie is so impressive for being for kids. He's clearly going through so much and i will continue to analyze this film further on later watches. I appreciate the time and effort put into creating this film, Sony has created a true masterpiece.
I wonder why many people think this movie is a flop, but i actually like it. Pls apreciate the animators!

Masterpiece. 100/10. I loved it and I don't see why everyone is so upset!? I cannot express in words how deeply moved I was by this film. It was about on the same emotionally stirring level as Moonlight(2016) or La La Land(2016). Scenes brought a tear to my eye. I think everyone can relate to the main character, Gene, on a spiritual level. However what made this movie fantastically amusing as well as deeply emotional was the brilliantly timed and clever humour. I will say there just wasn't enough poop jokes, there really should have been many more. However it's probably because I can't wrap my tiny mind around the genius of the writers, because this movie can't possibly do anything wrong.R.I.P Sir Patrick Stewart's career 💩💩💩💩

reviews.review_title: An Under-Rated Cinematic Masterpiece, even better than the Popeye movie
reviews.content: The Emoji Movie is a great animated movie. It's brilliantly animated, funny, and heartwarming.The story centers on Gene the emoji, who is supposed to be a "meh" emoji, but feels different emotions as well. When he goes into the "cube" (the place where the emojis "work", or wait to be used) for the first time, he makes the wrong face, causing the phone owner to think his phone is broken. Smile emoji, the sort of a Fascist dictator, wants to "delete", or otherwise exterminate Gene, with her "delete bots". Gene, and a few other misfits, go on an adventure to escape their town to the "cloud", where Gene can be reprogrammed. Meanwhile, the phone owner is deleting each app one by one, and is planning to delete the whole phone, and it's up to Gene to save his world.It's a good movie, but the reason it gets an 8 and not a 10 is because, well, the story is rather clichéd, being the tale of a misfit that somehow saves the day, but this is easy to be overlooked. Overall, this movie deserves more credit than it gets, and is worth a look. Give it a chance.

This movie was an inspirational excitement. I has a the best features a movies should have. I had the best jokes, and i was laughing all the way through. I don't understand all the negative comments, they clearly didn't understand the true meaning behind the movie. Underrated and brilliant.

I DID NOT like that the Eggplant was part of the never used emojis because lets be honest (we all know how much it is used). All in all this was a quality movie.
It's entertaining - and a nice takeout (it's ok to be yourself, not to fit in).my son (6 years old) loves it.

The emoji movie fascinates me. What you think is just a lazy cash grab by Sony animation, is actually an intelligent art film made by ancient scholars and philosophers. Now most film critics may disagree, but they are only humans, and it's their job to review films. Yes films, movies. And they go and they review the emoji movie like they would any other. But, unlike the name suggests, the emoji movie isn't a movie! It's much more! More like a work of art! A work of divine creation! You wouldn't grade a work of art the same way you would grade a film. You can't say a work of art has bad editing, writing or score music! Its best to just leave it alone as it's own being and not give it a rating. It's like going up into the beautiful Himalayan mountain range and giving the view a 7/10 and height a 10/10 and the temperature a 5/10, it just doesn't work and it makes no sense. But if I was to give the emoji movie a rating, I would give it a perfect score, not that it matters, but the fickle human mind is unfortunately influenced by what the critics say. But never mind that, just go see it yourself. It truly is an emojinal roller-coaster

reviews.review_title: Infinity/10, would watch every day for rest of my life.
reviews.content: I have seen reviews for Dunkirk saying it's the "best motion picture of the year." Well step aside, Dunkirk, as The Emoji Movie is the greatest gift from God ever. The idea of symbols used for communication coming to life within your phone is absolutely incredible. The acting was excellent, with a cast including T.J. Miller and Sir Patrick Stewart, it couldn't go wrong. It is about a multi-emotional emoji who has to have one emotion, but wants to have many. He makes friends such as Hi-5 and Jailbreak, and there is much sexual tension between them, leading to intensely captivating subplots. I won't give away too much, but I will say it gets pretty spicy between Poop and Gene at the end. Overall, it was a great movie, easily the best I've ever seen, I recommend you watch it every day for the rest of your life. Infinity out of ten.

To be fair, you have to have a very high IQ to understand Rick and Morty. The humour is extremely subtle, and without a solid grasp of theoretical physics most of the jokes will go over a typical viewer's head. There's also Rick's nihilistic outlook, which is deftly woven into his characterisation- his personal philosophy draws heavily from Narodnaya Volya literature, for instance. The fans understand this stuff; they have the intellectual capacity to truly appreciate the depths of these jokes, to realise that they're not just funny- they say something deep about LIFE. As a consequence people who dislike Rick & Morty truly ARE idiots- of course they wouldn't appreciate, for instance, the humour in Rick's existential catchphrase "Wubba Lubba Dub Dub," which itself is a cryptic reference to Turgenev's Russian epic Fathers and Sons. I'm smirking right now just imagining one of those addlepated simpletons scratching their heads in confusion as Dan Harmon's genius wit unfolds itself on their television screens. What fools.. how I pity them. 😂And yes, by the way, i DO have a Rick & Morty tattoo. And no, you cannot see it. It's for the ladies' eyes only- and even then they have to demonstrate that they're within 5 IQ points of my own (preferably lower) beforehand. Nothing personnel kid 😎

I think the best way to describe this masterpiece of cosmic horror is with a quote from an other masterpiece."Do you think god stays in heaven because he too lives in fear of what he's created?"Steve Buscemi, spy kids 2

reviews.review_title: Why don't people want you to see this film?!?!?
reviews.content: THE EMOJI MOVIE MARKS A NEW ERA IN ANIMATED CINEMAThe critical panning of the recently released "Emoji Movie" says more about the polarization between the elites and the populace then the quality of the film itself. Just one cursory glance at any "review" of the film that has been recently shoved down the throats of the public in a self-righteous attempt to shape the minds of the people will reveal just how distant the raving troglodyte we call the "film critic" is to the rational and well-tempered human that we all are. After viewing the film for the first time recently, I can safely conclude that the Emoji Movie must and shall be the stepping stone toward a society in which either the elitists are cast from their throne of pretentiousness by the common-folk, or cast out of society altogether, voluntarily or by force.The film opens with the "Columbia Pictures" logo (the one with the woman carrying the torch), only for the expectations of the consumer to be completely and violently subverted by the revelation that we are looking at this logo not through the lens of the projector, but through the lens of a cellphone's camera, as the frame zooms out to reveal that someone is taking a photo of this woman using the Snapchat app. Such a subversion of such a classic logo primes the audience for a spectacle that the consumer, and not the snob, can relate to. Gone are the days during which we must fabricate a fondness for dated symbols such as this woman and her torch. 1928 (the year of the logo's inception) was 89 years ago. We no longer wear stolas and carry torches. We have had electricity for over a century! Why should we feign amazement for such useless and inefficient technology as a torch? Only the most pretentious of film reviewers could take issue with this appeal to the masses. The day that we can finally live in the present has come; its name is July 28th, 2017!IMDb didn't let me post my full review; so go to http://www.picklesrevil.com/emoji.htm instead, as I am forced to abridge my review here.

Masterpiece. Simply a masterpiece.Emojis, yeah, I don't like them. But I still appreciate this movie.My grandchildren will watch this, they need to know what does art means.Excellent animation and dubbing.Burst out laughing at the theater.I've almost been banned for laughing that loud.God, this is possibly the best film ever made.Best of the year, deserves an Oscar. In all of the categories.Oh, I really enjoyed every single second of that movie.You really should watch it.
This movie was so cute! I loved it!! I don't understand why it hasn't such poor reviews! It was an adorable cartoon with a great storyline!

The Animation 10/10 - Brilliant
Really colorful and vibrant world, the art style is very cute and warming to watch. They did a fantastic job bringing the emojis to life, and it was really nice to see the visual experience the emojis had through various well known applications.The Story 9/10 - Great
The story definitely gave me subtle reminders of Wreck it Ralph. In the end it's a story about a defective emoji who really wants to fit in and be like the rest of his peers and family. It's heartwarming that he learns that being different is not bad; very similar concept to Wreck it Ralph. The journeys through the apps are exciting and really capture the essence of the apps, bringing a sense of liveliness to applications that we only get to see through a flat screen. During the entire film you get to experience various emotions and two major climactic scenes which revolved around deleting of apps and data. There were few parts of the movie where you lose interest or aren't really sure what is going on but it was overall really a fun experience. Conclusion 
The collaboration of animation, technology and new social norms have evolved to create an opportunity for this movie to exist. It was overall a great fun movie to watch for adults and kids.

This animated movie is SO UNDERRATED. Before it's release, I remember saying what everyone else did "Why are they making this movie?!" I was so quick to judge based on other animated films and "Hollywood's" reputation of unnecessary movies. Fast forward a couple years and I found this movie at my local library; figured I would give it watch with the family. We LOVED it! This movie was so well written. The animation was actually pretty good. T.J. Miller and James Corden were HILARIOUS together. So many good things occurred that I can't believe how poorly reviewed "Emoji Movie" was. If anyone rates this film lower than a 6/10 I think you may be biased by Pixar/Disney/DreamWorks expectations. The Emoji Movie was different but it was definitely good.

This movie has a great plot, some minor flaws here and there, but not enough to affect the score. The characters are really interesting and you witness them growing throughout the whole movie. All the jokes were incredibly edgy and sharp, truly the pinnacle of comedy. I never thought such perfect movie could even exist. 10/10 would watch again.

reviews.review_title: The Emoji Movie. The Greatest Movie of All Time.
reviews.content: Star Wars. Indiana Jones. Back to the Future. The Emoji Movie.The Emoji Movie brought tears to my eyes. Not only from laughing at the endless amount of poop jokes, but from the powerful acting that came from the Meh emoji and Jailbreak. The plot spoke to me on a spiritual level and taught me many useful lessons such as, "Why be one when there are no other numbers." I truly understood why Jailbreak would completely change her opinion after hearing those strong words. I also loved that after one of the three main characters "die", the other don't really seem to care and have a conversation about what they think of life. This really let the plot keep on moving and helped the movie not drag on for too long.All in all, I believe that the Emoji movie cannot be outdone in the cinematic world, and that thereby deserves my 10/10 review.My only gripe is that this movie did not have any fidget spinners.

"The Emoji Movie" is a film beyond words. With such prestigious actors, like "Sir Patrick Stewart," "James Corden," And so much more. It's really not that hard to see why. Let me break it down for you.1.) Plot.Gene is a meh emoji, in a world where everyone only has one emotion. Gene, though, has multiple. This proves a problem when on his first day at work, he messed up. The villain, "Smiler," tries to delete him because of it. He escapes her, teams up with "Hi-5," and finds "Jailbreak," a hacker. They go on an adventure through apps, like Youtube, and Just Dance, which, by the way, is now free for IOS and Android. Eventually, their user, Alex, gets tired of apps being triggered by the trio, so he schedules an appointment to get his phone wiped. Fortunately, Gene and the others save the day.2.) JokesOne of the only flaws of the movie is the humour. In the first 10 minutes, 5 poop jokes are made. I wish it was more. Another joke is that Gene's parents, also meh emojis, speak in the same monotone voice. It never gets old. Throughout the whole move, I was rolling over with laughter.3.) RatingI give the Emoji Movie a 10/10 because I realize that the Emoji Movie is the most original movie out there... People are all about Transformers 5, or Thor 4, or Spiderman Whatever, but I'm about Emoji Movie 1. It runs very smoothly, at a good 1080p HD 160fps. Also, as I already stated, the jokes are GREAT. The story is moving, it really is an Emoji-nal roller-coaster. And the spy attack really fits the scenes. Speaking of music, I forgot that the Just Dance App is now free for IOS and Android. The critics are 💯% WRONG! All in all, but as many tickets to the Emoji Movie as you can.

reviews.review_title: My sons and I really enjoyed the movie
reviews.content: I have 2 sons--they're 6 years old and 3 years old. They both love emoji's. I took them to the movies to see this flick, and they both loved it. My younger son wants to see it again already. I'm their 42 year old father and liked it too. I thought it very cleverly showed how apps and emoji's and smart phones and the cloud all link together. I expected not to like it, but I ended up really enjoying it. I would recommend it for sure. Probably more appropriate for young kids though.

This is the greatest movie i have ever seen. People hate on it because it is emojis but this movie is so much more than that. It has a lot of social commentary, it has a deep meaning, it has meaningful subplots, an engaging story, lovable characters, it has it ALL. If you haven't seen this movie, do yourself a favor and watch it. It will change your life.

reviews.review_title: A movie about a guy discovering who he truly is
reviews.content: The emoji movie is this summers top movie. It follows three main characters, gene, jailbreak and hi-5 as they journey to the cloud. Gene is a special emoji who is gifted with multiple emotions in a world where you can't be different, he meets up with our supporting characters to become what he must be, a meh. They run into many complications and grow as characters.I don't understand the hate surrounding this movie and frankly I'm insulted and confused why anybody would feel that way, I thought it was a masterpiece in every sense of the word. I couldn't stop laughing throughout the duration of the film. I enjoyed it incredibly. It was immersing, I related to every character on a deep emotional level, the main character Gene (played by famous actor T J Miller) seemed to grow so much and by the end it was like seeing the achievements of my own child. I loved the strong female character, it was great to see feminism portrayed I such a great way. Hi-5 was so funny and his design was humorous.Now let me tell you about the plot. This movie was deep, I found myself completely immersed and time seemed to fly. By the end I felt like a different person, this is so much more then a children's movie. I'd recommend to anybody to go see this movie. It seems like it will become a classic like pulp fiction or back to the future in no time. And trust me when I say, I've already got tickets to see it again. Over all I would give this movie a 9/10 and I'm a pretty tough critic. So make sure you get your tickets now and prepare for the best movie you'll see in a while. By the end you won't be going meh! ;)

There are loads of people hating on this movie, but I do not know the reason why. This is an excellent movie with a great and important plot. It dives deep into our soul and find our weaknesses, that is being too afraid to send a text to a crush. The cgi's are amazingly amazing and the shots are stunning. And the jokes! They crack me up so hard! Every single one of them, especially the poop jokes. I also like the fact that Patrick Stewart is wearing a poop costume. I definitely think this will be the movie of the year, no in fact, of the century! WTH Jeremy Jahns, you gave it a dog's poop? I don't blame him though, he is always drunk. Well, I will give it an Awesometacular.

When this movie was announced, Emoji enthusiasts such as myself rejoiced. Finally, our most beloved property would be able to transcend its original, limiting medium. However, this excitement was overshadowed by creeping doubt. What if the poop emoji was not given a complete character arc? What if the culturally diverse sushi Emojis were whitewashed and misrepresented by white actors? And what if corporate executives censored the socially important two-men-holding-hands Emoji?All doubts were dismissed upon viewing this cinematic masterpiece. The creators' respect for the Emoji community was evident in every frame of this immaculate work of art. I laughed, I cried, I sat on the edge of my seat, I repeated steps 1-3 countless times, and, finally, I emerged from the cinema a changed man. The unmatched humor, emotionally complex tone, and beautiful animation of the Emoji Movie left me with only one, burning question: who did this?
The storyline is quite good and so are the voice actors, I just dislike the... femenist part.Anyways, it's a great animated comedy movie!

But this still a great movie.

This movie was, without doubt,the best movie to ever hit the big screen. The characters were so real, so alive, that you could nearly feel their presence in the salon. I have never before been this affected by a film, and I truly believe that it is God who speaks to us through this movie.

reviews.review_title: A wonderful movie for the whole family!
reviews.content: The Emoji Movie is a movie like no other. It stands alone in its appeal to people of all ages and in its presentation of comedy, romance, and creative story line. The Emoji Movie is a delightful comedy about an emoji and his quest to fit in. The movie has a brilliant story line, following the path of a confused emoji as he discovers friendship and love all in the face of hysterical comedy. The story line is layered for different levels of understanding; it is an enjoyable film for people of all ages. While there are subtle comedic lines amuse adults, it is the simple humor, such as the Poop emoji going to the toilet," that amuses children. The amazing cast of The Emoji Movie, including TJ Miller and Sir Patrick Stewart do a great job of living up to expectations. The Emoji Movie has something for everyone; it is a great animated tale that is wonderful for adults and children alike.

reviews.review_title: This movie will be remembered in the ages, an utter classic, loved every minute of it
reviews.content: This is currently my favourite movie of all time, never before have I been that excited to view a new movie. The entire 90 minutes was an exhilarating rush. I truly wish that it were longer, that I could prolong this poignant emotional experience. The character development is movingly evident by the end of the film, we watch these emoji characters grow as individuals and its a beautiful thing to experience. The Emoji Movie, while targeted at children provokes the responder to recognize an underlying darkness set within the film. Such is conveyed through the surrounding impending mortality that this film uses as its basis. It reminds us that we too face the threat of mortality and that in itself is a truly moving notion that strikes the viewer completely unawares and allows the film to boast a more mature foundation that only true artists could pull off via the challenging medium that is feature film. In conclusion, the Emoji Movie was an emotional experience that truly changed my outlook on the world through mature themes and altogether exceptional take on the world of film.

Your mind just cannot comprehend the pure cinematic experience that is the Emoji Movie with its complex three dimensional characters, highly developed plot, beautiful settings and animation, its ability to tackle complex and modern issues of self worth and identity, and the fantastic comedic dialogue that cements it as the greatest comedy in cinematic history. To end this the emoji movie is an amazing piece of art in its purest form and should be treated as such and deserves to be held at the highest pedestal of cinematography earning not just an Annie but an Oscar and an Emmy too because this film is just that amazing you just weren't able to grasp what can only be described as perfection.

reviews.review_title: Not bad at all! But It's a heartwarming masterpiece!
reviews.content: I watched the Emoji Movie yesterday and I actually loved it! The Emoji Movie isn't really that bad after all. I did not cringe at all. The emojis are cute and funny, especially Gene made many funny faces! Their jokes are funny! You should take your kids and family with you to see this! It is a legitimately decent, colorful, adventurous, and touchingly heartwarming! This Emoji Movie seriously made me wanna watch this again and again! And now, here is an angry message to the people who write inappropriate bad reviews: Shame on you! It's just a harmless kids' animation! How could this film considered to be "suicidal," "cancerous" and "cringeworthy?" How can this film possibly will kill you? You people are overreacting and taking this movie way too seriously. They're just Emojis and they're not real! So stop taking them so seriously! Sony has worked very hard to keep you folks entertained just like Disney. You people should be ashamed of yourselves for brainwashing, forcing families with children to not watch this film for dumb reasons, writing inappropriate reviews and giving low scores for an innocently decent, harmless, kid-Friendly film!

The Emoji Movie: My opinionSo in a sense the entire film is about a meh emoji who feels more than one emotion. From a teenage point of view this doesn't sound like a very gripping plot but I did find this movie quite enjoyable for what it is. Despite the film being marketed for kids it still retains some jokes that teens may find somewhat funny. I will admit the product placement at times is a bit cringe, like with the candy crush and just dance portions of the film but fair play to James Corden he actually puts on quite a good show despite only being a voice of a character. I will admit however I felt sorry for Gene (the meh emoji) when he was rejected by Jailbreak as you could defiantly tell their was some kind of sexual tension between the two, despite being a kids film. I have a few criticisms, first off I am pretty sure the eggplant emoji gets used a hell of a lot. Also Sir Patrick Stewart has really gone down hill in my mind due to him playing as a poo instead of some of his more major roles in films like x men.Overall in my option the emoji movie is an OK kids film and people need to remember that this film is a kids film and not a Hollywood mega film (despite the 50 million USD budget) that is aimed for all. I will admit I went with low hopes to this film but was shocked at the fact I enjoyed it. All in all the film is OK for what it is but nothing that special. I would recommend this film to young children and teens. However don't go and see this film if you are expecting a masterpiece.

The Emoji Movie changed my life. It is by far the best thing I've ever seen and I've seen porn.Great fun for the whole family, love the jokes, especially the poop ones. Very original. Will amaze you and your child.Go watch The Emoji Movie, you won't regret it.

reviews.content: This was the best movie I have ever seen. I have no idea who these people are that are giving bad reviews, but I'm assuming individuals that have a purpose rather than ones that have seen this movie? It was absolutely adorable!I went with my 5 year old grandson and my daughter. All three of us loved the movie! Taking the enthusiastic applause from both young and old at the end of the movie, I'm assuming the same holds true for at least most of the rest of the audience. The few reviews I read seemed to want to find some deep meaning in this cute little cartoon. If they just watched the movie for the fun hourish it is, rather than getting into their own minds, the reviewers might have had a fun time. Don't go expecting anything other than a cartoon fun time as that is what it is. As that was what we were looking for, we had a perfect evening at the movies with this movie!!!

*Spoilers*The Emoji Movie is a thrilling and exhilarating ride through Just Dance, Candy Crush saga, and YouTube. Sadly the Tinder app did not make the cut, which would have added some more depth to the enjoyable world that Gene, Jailbreak and Hi-5 exist in for all us viewers to enjoy. First off, I'd like to talk about the controls. The Emoji Movie runs a solid 69 fps, which is better than I get on Overwatch every day, which is lovely. One of my original fears was that there would be an incredible amount of input lag, but thankfully. There was none. The Emoji Movie has around 20 ms of ping which is not bad. It's great! The controls were very responsive. Overall, Symmetra is still OP.Now I'd like to talk about the plot. I love the inclusion of the Just Dance app which for anyone who didn't know is now available on any IOS or Android device. Unfortunately, tinder (my favorite app) was not included in this wonderful piece of mastery. I was hoping that Gene and Jailbreak would fall in love over tinder, but the way it happened was fine I guess. Pen Pineapple Apple Pen was a wonderful addition, which many people to this day still know and love. Absolutely wonderful scene that was.Finally, I have only one piece of criticism. Sorry for the nitpicking. I was very upset to see that "It's Every Day Bro" was not included in this masterpiece of a film. I was very sad to see my Dad's music video not make the cut. However, I was very happy to see that the movie ended in a giant dance party. The song choice I believe could have been better (Maybe "It's Every Day Bro" would have fit better). But it's good to see all the characters rejoicing after their depression session.In COncLuSIoN, this film was absolutely incredible. Emojis down, the best movie I have ever seen. Anybody who disagrees can be banished the the fiery pits of the team 10 house. Thank you for reading my novel.

I nearly CRIED watching the sad scenes and when he got rejected SO HARD! Oof! Hit me right in the heart! Well, I hope you and your family get to watch this AMAZING film! :) Best Regards - Juan Martinez

reviews.review_title: Almost A Master Piece But A Bit Cringey.
reviews.content: The Emoji Movie is "Overhated". It Deserves More Love But It Can Be Very Cringe.

It would appear that most people hate this film because they are unable to grasp the inner concepts that this film was built around while appealing to a braindead audience who are easily amused - most people just see the stupidity. Let's attempt to break it down, though.Our heroes in the film are Emojis, but it really doesn't matter what they are, but rather, what they represent. Like Inside Out, Toy Story, Winnie the Pooh, or virtually any other kids film, the main characters are simply personifications. Their outward expressions and the world's expectations for them to keep those expressions is social commentary on how people are supposed to act in public, or in their professions. The Meh emoji represents inner turmoil at believing there's more out there than the safe expectations of society, he is an explorer, and societies differences give him depression.People have also complained about the plot about needing to reach Dropbox. Dropbox is yet another metaphor, just masked in something relevant to the setting. Exactly like Mount Doom in Lord of the Rings. It's an adventure story with plenty of heartfelt, meaningful messages and diverse, colorful charactersThis is Man vs self, man vs. faith, man vs destiny, man vs society, and man vs industry, depending on which character is focused on. The characters are well-rounded, as they all have individual character goals, motivations, and growth, all of which aren't without healthy flaws that act as obstacles to get them where they need to be right away.Hate for this movie makes no sense to me. It's relevant, the visuals and animation is pretty great, and a lot of thought was put into making it smart all around

reviews.review_title: james cordon is the thumb - best movie of all tome
reviews.content: I saw this movie and instantly evaporated into a higher plane of existence and met god. I literally transcended to another dimension of being. James cordon is living in my walls.

Not sure where all of the hate is coming from for this movie, I thought it was spectacular. I mean, didn't people go into it KNOWING it was a movie about freaking emojis? If that bothered you, I don't know why you would have watched it in the first place!I enjoyed the movie from minute one. It is very imaginative and at times poetic. Throughout the whole story I just found myself smiling and feeling good. Definitely a good pick me up if you are feeling down. The movie focuses on Gene, an emoji in a boy name Alex's phone who is destined to be the "meh" face. The twist is, unlike all of the other emojis in the phone, Gene can make multiple faces which ultimately makes him an outcast and the target of deletion. The real star for me in this movie is "jailbreak" (aka the princess emoji) who is played by Anna Faris. Dude, excellent choice giving the role of the most adorable emoji in the movie to one of the most adorable women in existence. I am not sure I would have liked it as much as I did if she was not the voice of this character. It is very poetic and ironic that Gene wants to be in the box being who he is "meant to be" while Jailbreak wants out of the box and has tried unsuccessfully to escape to the icloud. Gene's speech to her before her rejection caused him to be truly "meh" was very touching. I found Gene's friendship with Hi-5 to also be very enjoyable. Gene's parents were also unintentionally hysterical. One of my favorite parts is when Jailbreak and Gene are sailing on the "streams" and each one represents a different song. That is very clever! In the end, Gene's unique emotions is what finally gets Alex noticed by his crush Addie and he decides not to delete his phone for "malfunctioning." It reminded me a lot of Wreck it Ralph and Inside out. Very impressive animation and plot!I think kids and teenagers would definitely all love this movie as well as any adult who enjoys animation and who still has vivid imaginations.

The Trend Nowadays its seems is like if the Production company title doesn't say Disney , Marvel or Pixar the movie is bad and is trashed brutally. The Emoji movie falls in the above trap. Even I think there was nothing new in the movie but that does not mean it isn't good. It has some good laughs, Some tickly, some Funny, some heart touching moments. The Movie is paced fantastically. There is never a dull moment in the film. The Emoji theme base is just brilliant. All in all it is a terribly underrated fun movie not made by Pixar or Disney.

It's not a 10. It's not an 1. Its anything from a 6.6 to an 7.2 depending on your taste. They're is no way this movie is a 3.3. Such a low score should surely be reserved for an absolute catastrophe of a movie. This just isn't the case here.So, something must be going on here for the IMDb review score to be so wildly off kilter. This is not down to taste. The movie has a start, middle and an end. It has twists and laughs and characterisation. The (music) score isn't terrible and the plot is solid (though not exhilarating). So, why the low overall IMDb score? Could there be something in this movie that control freaks don't want you to see?Well, let's see...there's a constant threat of censorship/ deletion (sound familiar?). There are jibes at; social media; bots; the class system; spam; virus's; disgusting trolls; and so much more. It's also anti-establishment, so...yeah...there's that 🤔. (The false 3.3 score is starting to make sense now, huh?)
The movie shows us a 'robot-type boardroom executive' with no soul. Perhaps the insincerity of this character reminds the low raters of themselves...? Maybe, maybe not.The main character is named Gene. Was this chosen by accident? The main character is encouraged to 'be himself', how dangerous in today's world...
Perhaps the entire movie is just too close to the bone... I don't know. I just know it's not a 3.3.I was compelled to write this. So many nonsense reviewers. The truth is, the movie doesn't go far enough.I say 'well done', to the makers of this cartoon. It entertained me and my 6 year old kid....which is the demographic that the movie is aimed at. So, are the kids of the low raters not enjoying this movie? I doubt that.

This movie is truly a masterpiece that should have entire courses dedicated just to picking apart and deciphering all the intricacies that so wonderfully tie together to make the best film of this generation. When I see the low ratings people give this movie, rather than feeling angry - I feel sorry for these people. I understand why the ratings are so low, not everyone is capable of truly understanding a film as metaphorical and nuanced as this. It isn't your fault if you couldn't comprehend what Tony Leondis was trying to do, but I do hope you begin unpacking your preconceived biases that make you unable to fully understand and enjoy hard hitting queer films like this. Sony truly made history by giving us such a realistic and heartwarming depiction of gender fluidity, and it's obvious that this is something close to their heart as shown by their more recent movie "The Mitchells vs. The Machines" which features a lesbian main character. Sony is taking it upon themselves to bring us the important queer films that other animation studios are too scared to make, it's extremely inspiring. I hope any of you that thought The Emoji Movie was simply a lazy attempt at making money by taking something extremely prevalent in our society (emojis) and throwing in some poop jokes - will try watching it a few more times. Me and my peers regularly get together just to rewatch The Emoji Movie, taking in all the details, oftentimes making lists of new things we didn't notice before - and then we discuss it together, sharing our revelations and the new lesson we've learned (because no matter how many times we watch it - The Emoji Movie somehow manages to teach us something new each time). I'll have to wrap up my review now, lest I go on forever. Though personally, I think of this less as a review and more as a love letter to the greatest film to ever grace our earth, and I urge everyone of you to watch it again with an open mind - it may surprise you.

reviews.review_title: Everyone is so sensitive...it's a CARTOON!!!

Yes it's predictable...but so is every romcom, horror movie, disney princess movie etc. Just enjoy they simplicity of the film and stop making it out to something so repulsive. If you don't like it go read a book for mental stimulation. The movie was cute. Simple as that.
I loved this movie! Light, made me laugh several times!!

reviews.review_title: Quite possibly the greatest achievement in all of cinema
reviews.content: My great grandson and I went to see this film with quite low expectations. Once we had seen the first glimpse of the picture, we knew we were in store for something phenomenal. In all my 98 years of existence, I had seen brilliant pictures such as Citizen Kane, Pulp Fiction, 2001: A Space Odyssey and i had enjoyed each and every one of them, however, to even attempt to compare these slightly above average pictures to the likes of a masterpiece such as The Emoji Movie is such a silly thought to me. The film is such a masterpiece that I am inclined to believe that it was animated by artists, voice acted by the jost prestigious singers, written by the most brilliant philosophers and directed by the most intelligent and creative man in existence. The Emoji-Bop will stick with me throughout the rest of my life and i would love for it to be played at my funeral. My biggest regret in life is that The Emoji Movie did not come out earlier, as I would love to have done the Emoji-Bop with my wife at my wedding. A masterpiece. Cinema at its finest.
It's a kids movie! It's funny and sweet. People need to stop being so hateful and cynical. It's a laugh and lovely!

The plot is great! The characters are awesome! The final battle is epic! It's my favorite movie of all time!This is the best movie I ever heard in my entire life!You got to watch this. It's super awesome!
This is a great movie with an XD CaSt of waCkY eMojIs.

Just the mere thought of the emojis in my phone begging to be chosen and used by me makes me feel powerful. They want it so bad.This movie was so good and well thought out that my grandparents actually rose from the dead so that they could watch it with me, admiring the details of it all, while being overcome with disappointment that they never thought up something quite as genius back in their day.I must say I especially love the character design here. I mean, what a bunch of hotties. I am not ashamed to say that I am attracted to the walking hand who speaks with the buttery smooth and velvety voice of James Corden. I would leave my hypothetical husband for him in a heartbeat.My depression is cured, I am a straight A student, and my dad came back, all because of this movie. I owe all of my existence to this work of art, and to the exceptional minds behind it. Thank you. You have made such a profound difference with this.

This is truly one of the classics of modern cinema, and will no doubt be remembered as one of the greatest movies of all time. It's easily in league with films such as Star Wars, The Godfather, Jaws and Raiders of the Lost Ark. How anyone can give this movie a bad review is beyond me because it is clearly a masterpiece. One of the most intelligent, action packed and suspenseful movies ever to hit theaters.
